Elguja requested credit for the expansion of his rabbit-breeding farm. He has 85 rabbits. He sells them on the Kutaisi and Samtredia (nearby towns) open markets. Elguja also has 2 pigs and sells piglets in the local market. The total average monthly income of the family is 580 Laris, including the monthly pension of Elguja’s mother. 

Elguja requested credit to purchase materials for a rabbit hutch expansion, as the existing rabbit hutch is too small and doesn’t allow him to keep more rabbits. Also, part of the requested funds will be used to purchase rabbit feed for the winter season. After the expansion of the rabbit hutch, Elguja will keep more rabbits and increase sales. He will get more income and will be able to improve the living conditions for himself and his old mother.

loans.use: to purchase materials for a rabbit hutch expansion and feed for the rabbits

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new inventory and renovate his store

loans.name: Dionelina

texts.en:
Dionelina is a 41-year-old widow with two children currently in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Dionelina buys and sells firewood in the Philippines. Dionelina requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of firewood to sell.

Dionelina has been in this business for 10 years. Dionelina would like to save enough money to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of firewood to sell.

loans.name: Sarmad

texts.en:
Sarmad is from Iraq. He is 28 years old, single and lives with six family members of whom three work.

Sarmad has owned a children’s clothing store since 2010. He has more than four years experience in this field. He has a deep understanding of customer’s needs and a good reputation, and he is well known in his surroundings. His store is situated in a commercial area so a number of potential customer pass by.

He decided to apply for a $3,000 loan in order to buy an electric generator and a mannequin and to make showcases for his store. He is aiming to gain more profits in order to to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to buy an electric generator and a mannequin and to make showcases for his store.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 52 years old and married with six children.  He lives in his own semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda.

His dream for his family is to construct a better house for his family and also educate his children.  Stephen sells tea and has been in this business for the last twenty years.  He has not had any major hardships, and his dream is to be a tea wholesaler.  Stephen needs this loan to buy tea to sell.

loans.use: to buy tea to sell.

loans.name: Sam At

texts.en:
Sam At sells boiled corn. Her husband Kimseng is a construction worker. They live along National Road number five, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have two daughters who are attending school. 

Sam At is asking for a loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her husband to drive to work.

loans.name: Dorita

texts.en:
Dorita works hard to support her family. Dorita is married and has a scrapping business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years now and also earns an additional income from her general store business.

Dorita requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more scrap to resell.

In the future, Dorita would like to build and expand her business to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more scrap to resell.

loans.name: Zoulfokar

texts.en:
Zoulfokar is from Iraq. He is 21 years old, single and lives with four family members of whom one works.

Zoulfokar has owned a blacksmith workshop since 2010, where he makes windows and doors. He has more than three years experience in this field and a deep understanding of local customers. He has a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $2,100 loan in order to buy an electric generator for his workshop. He is aiming to gain more profits to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to buy an electric generator for his workshop.

loans.name: Pho

texts.en:
Pho sells recycling materials and drives an auto rickshaw. His wife Navy is a garment worker. They have been married since 1990 and have five children -three sons and two daughters. The family lives along National Road Number 6, about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

All of Pho’s children are in school, and one of them is in university. So, Pho his asking for another loan of $300 to pay the school fees for his son who is in university.

loans.use: to pay the school fees for his son who is in university.

loans.name: Maksat

texts.ru:
Максату 32 года, женат  и является любящим отцом двух дочек – 3 года и 1 годик. Максат имеет средне-специальное образование в фармацевтической деятельности. В 2007 году Максат решил открыть свой собственный бизнес в реализации и ремонте оправ и очков, используя стартовый капитал в сумме 20.000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день Максат имеет оборудование по ремонту очков и товарооборот на сумму 20,000 сом (KGS) приносящий доход в сумме около 15,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития бизнеса, Максат обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) для увеличения ассортимента товара и приобретения деталей для ремонта очков. Доходы от кредита он намерен использовать на покупку офтальмологического оборудования для определения зрения. 
В будущем, Максат планирует накопить деньги для покупки своей квартиры.
texts.en: Maksat is 32 years old, married and is a loving father of two daughters, who are three and one years old.  Maksat has a secondary-specialized education in the pharmacy business.  He decided to open his own business of selling and repairing glasses frames and glasses in 2007, using a a starting capital of 20,000 som (KGS).  Today, Maksat has equipment needed for repairing glasses and has a goods turnover of 20,000 som (KGS) that yields an income of about 15,000 som (KGS) per month.  In order to further develop his business, Maksat requested a loan in the sum of 60,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to expand his goods assortment and buy parts for glasses repair.  He plans to use the income from the loan to buy ophthalmology equipment for determining eyesight.  In the future, Maksat plans to save money to buy his own apartment.

loans.use: to expand merchandise assortment and to buy parts for glasses repair

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is from Iraq. He is 23 years old, married and lives with eight family members of whom three work.

Hasan has owned a car repair workshop since 2007. He has more than five years experience in this field. He has a deep understanding of local consumers and has a good reputation. He is well known in his area.

He is requesting $1,800 loan to improve his workshop with a sliding door and an outdoor ceiling and to buy an electric generator. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: To improve his workshop with a sliding door, an outdoor ceiling and an electric generator.

loans.name: Sophoin

texts.en:
Sophoin (pictured with her loom) is a weaver, and her husband Sin is a farmer. They live in a small village along the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

They have three children - two sons and one daughter. One child is a construction worker, another is hired to sell desserts and gets paid with fees, and the third child is in school. 

Sophoin is asking for a loan of $600 to purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Silvester

texts.en:
Silvester is 66 years old and married with ten children, aged seventeen to forty, living in his own house in Hoima, Uganda. He has been milling corn and rice for six years, and he faces the hardship of inadequate capital which affects his business profits. 

His dream is to buy a peanut milling machine. Silvester wants a loan to buy produce like rice and corn to sell.

loans.use: to buy rice and corn to sell.

loans.name: Gocha

texts.en:
Gocha is from the village Geguti in West Georgia.  He is 44 years old, married, and lives with his wife Guranda, 16 year old daughter, 12 year old son, and his mother-in-law (retired).  Both children go to school. 

The family earns a living through agricultural activities.  In particular, they have two greenhouses.  In the period of October through May, greens are grown.  In the months of June through September the greenhouses are used for growing cucumber.  Gocha sells harvested greens to the wholesale exporters, who export greens to the Ukraine.  He sells harvested cucumbers himself at a local open market.  Guranda, his wife, is also actively involved in the family agriculture business.  The total average monthly income of the family is 900 Laris, including the pension of Gocha’s mother-in-law. 

Gocha requested credit for purchasing fertilizers.  After fertilizing the land in the greenhouses, he will get a better quality harvest and be able to sell it for a good price.  It will positively affect the family income and consequently their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilzers for the greenhouses.

loans.name: Kaed

texts.en:
Kaed is from Iraq. He is 37 years old, married and has three children.

Kaed has owned a children’s clothing store since 2006. He has more than four years experience in this field. He has a deep understanding of customers’ needs and a good reputation, and he is well known in his surroundings. His store is situated in a commercial area so a number of potential customers pass by.

He decided to apply for a $2,400 loan in order to buy an air conditioner and to make a sliding door and a digital ad for his store. He is aiming to gain more profits in order to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to buy an air conditioner and to make a sliding door and a digital ad for his store.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 51 years old and married. She has three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Elizabeth has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like pants, blouses and curtains to sell.

Elizabeth has been in this business for eight years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like pants, blouses and curtains to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a 45 year old single lady with two children living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda.  Her dream is to build her own permanent house and expand her business.  Grace operates a clothing boutique.  She also has decorating materials for hire.  She has been in this business for five years.  Her major challenge has been untimely debt settlements which have affected her business plans.  Her dream is to have an events shop.  Grace needs this loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to add to her boutique.

loans.name: Kazem

texts.en:
K. is from Iraq. He is 30 years old, married and has four children.

K. has owned an entertainment store since 2008. He has all kinds of video games. He has a deep understanding of local customers and a good reputation, and he is well known in his area. His store is situated in a crowded area so a number of potential customers pass by.

He decided to apply for a $1,500 loan in order to renovate and change the decorations in his store. He is aiming to gain more profits in order to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to renovate and change the decorations in his store.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda works hard to support her family. She is widow and has a food vending business in the Philippines. Erlinda has been in this business for 10 years.

Erlinda requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha works hard to support her family. She is married and sells ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines. Editha has been in this business for 9 years.

Editha requested a 19,500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items like blouses, pants, etc. to sell to customers. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more items like blouses, pants etc. to sell to customers

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 30 years old, married and has three children.

He has owned a home appliance store since 2007. He has a good experience in this field and a deep understanding of local consumers. He has a good reputation and he is well known in his area. His store is situated in a crowded area so there are a number of a customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a 2,800 USD loan in order to renovate and fix his store’s ceiling, floors and walls. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to renovate and fix his store’s ceiling, floors and walls

loans.name: Labarhan's Group

texts.en:
Labarhan is the leader of this group.  She is 61 years old and married to a taxi driver.  Labarhan is a retiree and in order to earn money for her livelyhood she breeds cattle.  The family started cattle breeding activity in 1990 with an initial investment of 30,000 soms.  By reselling the cattle after fattening and selling the dairy products, Labarhan earns about 2,600 soms per month.  This profit made it possible to save money and build a house for her son.  With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase a cow to increase the number of cattle.  In the near future, Labarhan plans to celebrate her younger son’s wedding.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Quat's Group

texts.en:
Quat was born in Dai Bi village. She has two daughters who are going to school. Her husband is a guard. 

Mrs Quat has a shop in the market. She sells dresses and clothes. She has this job for 5 years. Her famiL. has an income of about 7,000,000 Vietnamdong(VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2006. The last time, she borrowed 5,014,000 VND and repaid punctualL.. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 6,322,000 VND to buy more new clothes and dresses to sell. She is the leader of a 5 member group in SEDA.
 
About other borrowers in her group:

Nghi is 39 years old. She is tailor. She has two children. She would like to borrow 6,322,000 VND to buy cloth.

T. is 55 years old. She has three children. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to invest in her store(to buy more cobbler supplies).

Dung is 45 years old. She has one child. She wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND to invest in her small business.

Loc is 28 years old. She has two children. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to business food available.

loans.use: to buy more new clothes and dresses to sell.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 29 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Janet has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal.

Janet aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mavlina

texts.en:
Mavlina is from the village of Kumistavi, Imereti Region, West Georgia. She is 49 years old and lives with her husband (Zurab), her 21 year old son and two daughters (22 and 20 years old). 

Mavlina’s daughters are students in a high-school. Zurab and his son are workers and they work in the village. Mavlina is leading the agricultural business for the family. In particular, she has 2 cows, produces on average 40 kg cheese per month, and sells it at the local market. At the same time, she has 100 nut trees. Nuts are sold in season to the wholesalers. Total average monthly income of the family is 1200 Laris. 

Mavlina requested credit for the realization of her new business idea. The village where she lives is a tourist zone in the country. Recently, because of the active promotion of tourism in the country, the amount of tourists increased in her village. She plans to start up a trade with grocery products. With the requested credit she will buy the products, which are most demanded by the tourists, and sell them from her home (as the home has a good location for trade business). 

This new business initiative will increase the income of the family. Mavlina will be able to provide better care for her children and pay the study fees for the daughters.

loans.use: to purchase grocery products for grocery store.

loans.name: Judeline

texts.en:
Judeline works hard to support her family. Judeline is married and has a fruit (banana) business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more bananas to sell in her stall.

Judeline has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Judeline would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a variety of products like rice, shampoo & rubber bands.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 1 child. 

Leonora has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, green bananas & vegetables, like squash. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy snacks, green bananas & vegetables to sell.

Leonora has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Leonora hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy snacks, green bananas & vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Baydaa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 29 years old, married and has three children.

Baydaa has been a tailor since 2005. She makes and repairs women’s clothing. She has a deep understanding of local consumer needs and a good reputation and she is well known in her area.
 
She is requesting a $2400 loan to buy a generator, an air conditioner and a tailoring machine. She is aiming to gain more profits so she can improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a generator, air conditioner and a tailoring machine.

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en:
Marciana is 65 years old and married with three children. Marciana works very hard to provide for them. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Marciana has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, detergent and groceries. 

In the future Marciana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Fredrick Kilyungi

texts.en:
Fredrick is a 27 year old married man. He describes himself to be quiet, persistent, and patient. He operates a restaurant business where he sells tea, rice, chapati and beef stew. He has been involved in this business for 2 months and employs 2 staff members. His business is located in a commercial area and his primary customers are business people. 

Fredrick describes his biggest business challenges to be that business is slow and inconsistent and sales only take place in the evening. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase chairs for the restaurant, flour, sugar and cereals. His business goal is to open other restaurants in other parts of town within 5 years. He hopes that, in the future, he will diversify to open a school, since he and his wife are both teachers.

loans.use: To purchase chairs, flour, rice and cereals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making sweetened rice cakes, or suman.

loans.name: Hassoun

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 44 years old, married and has four children. 

Hassoun has been the owner of a food market since 2003, selling soft drinks, juices, cheese and dairy products. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. 

He decided to apply for a $2400 loan in order to buy a large showcase and a generator. He is aiming to earn more profit to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to buy a large showcase and a generator.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 32-year-old man. He is married and has two sons and two daughters. He owns a store selling car accessories and he wants to expand in his work and purchase a large amount of car accessories to have a wider collection to sell and improve his income but the amount of money he has isn't enough to pay, so he needs to take a loan in the amount of $3,000 from FATEN. 

When he gets the loan which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will be able to pay easily for purchasing the amount he needs of car accessories and have a better collection to sell. That will reflect positively on his income and he will have better living conditions with his family. 

Mohammad is photographed in his FATEN branch.

loans.use: To pay for a large amount of car accessories.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & noodles.

loans.name: Mose

texts.en:
Mose is a married woman. She has eight  children, three of whom attend school while the other 5 children are married. They live at their own house that has neither electricity, nor piped water. Her monthly expenses are food and school fees for the family.

For the past 10 years, Mose has operated a cattle selling business. She sells her cattle at the market to her neighbours and butcher shops. Her major challenges are disease outbreak and seasonality in her business.  She dreams of having her own slaughter house in the future.

With the KES 40,000.00 she wants to purchase herds of cattle. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase herds of cattle.

loans.name: Tengiz

texts.en:
Tengiz is a farmer from the village Dimi, Imereti Region, West Georgia. He is 59 years old and lives with his wife, Rusudan. 

Tengiz is retired; he is in good health and leads the agricultural business of the family, which is the main source of the income for them. Tengiz and Rusudan have 2 milking cows. Rusudan produces, on average, 40 kg traditional Georgian cheese. She sells it at the local market. Also, the family has 3 calves. Along with the above mentioned, they own a vineyard with 2000 vine plants. Tengiz produces wine and sells it at the local market. 

Tengiz has requested credit for purchasing one more milk cow and expansion of the vineyard. He will plant additional vines and produce more grapes. As a result of credit, the income of the family will increase and they will be able to sell more cheese and wine. 

Tengiz plans to reinvest part of the increased income into the same businesses. The other part of the loan will be used for purchasing new household goods to improve family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow and materials for vineyard expansion.

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Said is a nurse. In 2000, he opened a store where he sells medical and first aid supplies. He has more than 20 years' experience in nursing and patient care and has a good reputation. He is well known in his area. 

Said is 45 years old, married and has two children, who both work. He is from Iraq. 

Said decided to apply for a $2,100 loan in order to make a showcase and a digital ads board. He is aiming to gain more profit. This will give him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to make a showcase and a digital ads board.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. 

Emily is providing jeepney, or multipurpose jeep services, with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for 6 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy tools & to pay for the gasoline for the maintenance of the vehicle.

Emily has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future. Emily hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools & to pay for the gasoline for the maintenance of the vehicle.

loans.name: Rysbek

texts.ru: Рысбек – счастливый отец четверых дочерей, живущий со своей семьей в г. Нарын (север Кыргызстана).  В 1995 году, Рысбек с супругой решили начать свой собственный бизнес в перепродаже овощей и фруктов. Стартовав с суммы в 2,000 сом (KGS), Рысбек сумел развить свой бизнес с ежемесячным доходом в сумме 5,000 сом (KGS). Огромные усилия и упорный труд позволили Рысбеку улучшить условия проживания семьи и приобрести машину Мерседес для перевозки фруктов и овощей. Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Рысбек обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS).  В будущем, Рысбек мечтает купить большой дом для своей семьи.
texts.en: Rysbek is a happy father of four children.  He lives with his family in the Naryn town (northern Kyrgyzstan).  In 1995, Rysbek and his wife decided to start their own business of reselling vegetables and fruits.  Using a starting capital of 2,000 som (KGS), Rysbek was able to develop his business to have a monthly income of 5,000 som (KGS).  A lot of effort and hard work allowed Rysbek to improve his family's living conditions and to buy a Mercedes vehicle for transporting fruits and vegetables.  To further develop his business, Rysbek requested a loan in the sum of 80,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company.  In the future, Rysbek dreams of buying a big house for his family.

loans.use: to further develop his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula is a single woman with one child who attends school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her monthly expenses are for food.

For the past year, she has operated a shop kiosk selling to neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is competition with other shop sellers. She dreams of having her own retail shop in the future.

With the 20,000 Kenyan shilling (KES) loan she wants to purchase bags of sugar, loaves of bread, and dry fish for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loan funding.

loans.use: to purchase bags of sugar, loaves of bread, and dry fish for resale.

loans.name: Esther Kadogo

texts.en: Esther is a 33-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from three to ten years old. She describes herself to be a visionary. She operates a tailoring services business where she sells materials and provides dressmaking services. She has been involved in this business for five years and employs two staff members. Her business is located within a shopping center in Kakamega. She describes her biggest business challenges to be a poor roads network and seasonality. She will use the 40,000 Kenyan shilling (KES) loan to purchase materials. Her business goal is to buy ten more sewing machines and employ more people within five years. She hopes that in the future she will have expanded her business to wholesale.

loans.use: to pay for materials for her tailoring services business.

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with seven children. 

Virgie provides motorela or habal-habal services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan for 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy tools and pay for gasoline and maintenance.

Virgie has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Virgie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline and maintenance

loans.name: Urjinbadam

texts.en:
Mrs. Urjinbadam, 56, is a teacher at The Government Training Center. She lives with her husband; all of her children are living individually. She has been working as a teacher for 36 years and she has had many pupils since she started teaching. Urjinbadam also does custom decorating jobs on order from her customers for the holidays.

One of Urjinbadam's daughters was married this year and is planning to move out of her parents house. Because of this she needs to buy another apartment that is not so expensive, but she lacks the money for an advance payment on an apartment. Therefore, Urjinbadam decided to support her daughter and is taking a loan to cover the advance payment of the new apartment.

loans.use: To cover the advance payment of a new apartment.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 53-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and four young children. He has 35 years of experience working in the mechanics field. In 1976, he opened a car repair shop. His work is specialized in repairing all American cars.

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1500 from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to purchase needed mechanical equipment. He is optimistic about his business development and hopes that the coming year will continue to bring him positive growth.

loans.use: To purchase needed mechanical equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Dzame

texts.en:
Dzame is a married woman with six children, five of whom attend school while one is married. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  Her biggest monthly expense is food.

For the past three years she has operated a palm wine selling business, selling to her neighbors and passers-by.  Her major challenge is seasonality. She dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.

With the Kshs. 20,000 she wants to establish a food stall business with the purchase bundles of wheat flour and maize flour. Dzame decided to join Yehu to access loans.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour and maize flour to establish her food stall.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children. 

Virginia provides a motorela or habal-habal services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for maintenance.

Virginia has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Virginia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for maintenance

loans.name: Tamar

texts.en:
Tamar is from the village Nakhakhulevi. She is 38 years old, married and lives with her husband Guram, her 17 year old son, 16 year old daughter and her parents in law (retired). Guram works in a local furniture factory as a worker and gets monthly salary. Her children go to school. 

Tamar is leading the agricultural business side of the family. She tends 2 greenhouses. In the period of October – May greens are grown in the greenhouses, while for the months June – September they are used for cucumber and tomato growing. Tamar sells harvested greens to the wholesalers. She sells harvested cucumbers and tomatoes at the local open market. Along with the above mentioned, Tamar has 2 milk cows. She produces approximately 40 kg of traditional Georgian cheese and sells it at the local market as well. Total average income of the family including the pensions of Tamar’s parents in law is 850 Laris. 

Tamar requested credit for purchasing additional dairy cow. She will be able to produce and sell more cheese and increase the family income. She plans to use the increased income for financing the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 42 year old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and four young children. He has been working as a car mechanic for 30 years, and he opened the garage he is working at in 2007. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to purchase mechanical machinery to facilitate his business operation. He notes that this machinery will help him repair the cars faster and more easily. 

This is his fifth cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower, with a good standing history. Hassan specializes in fixing car bodies and color. In the future, he is planning to expand his business into other areas.

loans.use: To purchase mechanical machinery

loans.name: Monica Adhiambo

texts.en: Monica is a married woman. She has five children ranging from 14 to 25 years. She describes herself as obedient, kind, and straight forward. She operates a retail shop where she sells eggs, sodas, water, vegetables, and fish. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located at the busy Kibuye market in Kisumu. She will use the Kes 80,000 loan to add stock of eggs and vegetables. She hopes that in the future she will diversify into a spare auto parts sales business.

loans.use: To pay for eggs and vegetables.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 
Mary Jane has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, rice per kilogram, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.
Mary Jane has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Mary Jane hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Tue's Group

texts.en:
Tue was born in 1964. She lives in Cau Ca village, Co Loa commune. She has three children. They grew up. Her main job is farming. Not only growing rice, but also raising pigs and poultry. She has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 VietnamD. (VND). She has previously participated in SEDA; the last time she borrowed 7,630,000 VND and repaid it punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,502,000 VND to breed pigs and poultry.
About other borrowers in her group:
Doan is 39 years old. She has two children. She wants to borrow 7,630,000 VND to buy scrap-iron to resell.
Ngan is 32 years old. She has two children. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy food for pigs.

loans.use: to breed pigs and poultry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Marteris

texts.en:
Marteris is married with 4 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marteris is 42 years old and has 1 child who is in school.

Marteris has a food vending business in the Philippines. Marteris has requested a PHP 23,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Marteris has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Marteris would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Kaphemba

texts.en:
Kaphemba is a married woman with 7 children, three of whom attend school while four are married. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past 10 years, she has operated a dry fish selling business, selling to neighbors. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation from rural areas to her place of operation. She dreams of having a wholesale business in future.

With KES 30,000 she wants to purchase sacks of dry fish for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of dry fish for resale.

loans.name: Precilla

texts.en:
Precilla is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. She has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 4 years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. Precilla has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Precilla hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Trisita

texts.en:
Trisita works hard to support her family. Trisita is married and has a junk shop business in the Philippines.

Trisita has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy more scrap for resale.

Trisita has been in this business for 8 years.

In the future, Trisita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more scrap for resale

loans.name: Garatel

texts.ru:
Garatel zamujem i imeyet 3 detey. Ona yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda, seychas projivayet v Fzuuli regione posolok Makhmudlu vmeste so svoim mujom i detmi. Garatel 53 qoda. 
Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit kuricci dlya razvitiya svoyego dela. Garatel uje 8 let kak zanimayetsya pticevodstvom i razvodit kuric.
texts.en: Garatel is married and has three children.  She is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from the city of Fuzuli and now lives in the Fuzuli region, in the Makhmudlu village together with her husband and children.  Garatel is 53 years old.  Currently, she needs 2000 AZN in order to buy chickens for developing her business.  Garatel has been involved in poultry farming and breeding chickens for eight years.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with 6 children. Melinda has a shop that sells canned goods, breads, noodles and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. Melinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with two children, both of whom graduated from school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and paraffin.

For the past three years she has operated a retail shop business, selling to neighbors and passersby.  Her major challenge is the high cost transportation incurred in her business. She dreams of having her own wholesale shop in the future.

With KES 30,000 she wants to purchase bags of sugar and maize flour for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans.

loans.use: To purchase bags of sugar and maize flour for resale.

loans.name: Yuri

texts.en:
Yuri is a bee-keeper from the village Zeda Dimi, Imereti Region, West Georgia. He is 52 years old and lives with his family (his wife, Eteri, and his 27-year-old son). All family members are involved in this family agricultural business, which is the main source of income for them. They own 2 milk cows and calves. Eteri produces on average 40 kg of traditional Georgian cheese, which is sold to local dairy product retailers. Also they have 150 vine trees from which Yuri produces wine which he sells at a local market. 

Along with the above mentioned, Yuri has 16 bee-hives and bee-families. He has much experience in bee-keeping. He harvests honey twice a year and sells it at a local market. The total average monthly income for the family is 750 GEL. 

Yuri requested credit to purchase 4 or 5 additional bee-hives and bee-families. He will get more honey and more income from honey sales. Yuri plans to reinvest received profit in the bee-keeping business in order to expand it.

loans.use: to purchase 4 or 5 beehives and bee families.

loans.name: Tebajjukira Development Group

texts.en:
"A prolific, lusty, trail blazing and purposeful enterpreneur" may be just the right words to describe 55-year-old Robert, who operates a retail enterprise in Lugazi. This enterprising father of 12 started giving a good account of himself in this trade a decade ago. Robert exudes nothing but confidence.
He set forth in his business on his own hook and all the strides he has made have come as a result of his unwavering and tenacious hard work ethic.
It’s fair to say Robert is now on the inside lane to become a past master in business. He has soaked up loads of experience, and day in, day out, Robert feels he is getting well posted with the nitty gritty and fundamentals of running a business. Does this spell success for his enterprise? In many respects it does.

He has been able to handle most of his adversity philosophically. Robert has also made sure he does not get complacent as his business grows. Before he nurtured the idea of bearing a hand in this business, Robert was mostly inclined to a coffee selling business. His auxiliary businesses (to wit, cattle and food sales) have aided him in the consolidation of his business profits. Weekly, Robert says this business generates him sales returns totaling to Uganda shillings 25,000.

The records indicate that Robert's group is on their 4th loan cycle. Their repayment record is up to the mark. Robert says he is going to use his loan proceeds to purchase more retail commodities such as maize flour, beans, rice, salt, sugar, etc. to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more retail commodities such as maize flour, beans, rice, salt, sugar, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. Emma provides motorela or habal-habal services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for 5 years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy tools and pay for gasoline and maintenance. Emma has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Emma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline and maintenance.

loans.name: Josephina

texts.en:
Josephina is married and is spending ample time caring for her baby. Josephina is 22 years old and lives in Santo Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur, Philippines.

To earn a living, she owns and operates a retail store at home, offering most basic commodities and a few of other items, like school and office supplies, and accessories like hairpins, clips and headbands, etc. She has been running the business for over three years. Each month, she earns about PHP 6,800 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 at GDMPC to purchase additional products to sell. 

Josephina is a current member of GDMPC. This is her second loan amount drawn out from the cooperative. In the future, Josephina hopes to improve and expand her business array to gain more income, thereby improving the general living conditions of the family.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 58 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 9 children. She has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. Josefina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 32-year-old married man with three children, living in Fort Portal, Uganda. Peter's dream is to build a family house and also educate his children. He is a taxi driver and has been in service for the last fifteen years. He started by first working as a casual laborer, and with the wages earned he bought a taxi. His challenge is high fuel prices, and his dream is to own at least three taxis. Peter needs the loan facility to service his taxi.

loans.use: To service his taxi.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 44 years old and lives in the village of Panduman, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur, Philippines.  She is widowed with 4 school-aged children. 

To earn a living, Cecilia has a business selling salted fish and dried fish. She has been renting a space in the town market for over five years. She wakes up early in the morning to start the business operations. She treats her customers very well.  She earns about PHP 8,400 each month for her work. 

Cecilia has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 at GDMPC to purchase additional stocks of salted and dried fish to sell.

Cecilia has been a member of GDMPC since 2008.  This is the fourth loan transaction made in GDMPC. She has successfully repaid all the previous loans taken out from the cooperative. In the future, Cecilia would like to expand business outlook to obtain more income and to improve the general living condition of the family.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of salted and dried fish  to sell.

loans.name: Yane

texts.en:
Yane works hard to support her family. Yane is married and has a tricycle transport business in the Philippines.

Yane has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase tools and equipment for her tricycle.

Yane has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future, Yane would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase tools and equipment for her tricycle

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 56 years old and lives in the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur, Philippines.  She is widowed with five children. 

To earn a living, Juanita has a business selling a variety of vegetables and dry goods in the local market. Her children help her attend to customers' needs when they have no classes or work. She has been working in the noisy, crowded, and messy place of business for over 21 years, but has learned to love the market over the years.  She earns about PHP 8,800 each month.  Juanita has requested a loan of PHP 12,000 at GDMPC to purchase additional products for sale.

Juanita has been a member of GDMPC since 2009.  This is Juanita's sixth loan cycle at GDMPC.  She has repaid in full, all the previous loans.  In the future, Juanita would like to expand her business and improve it even more, to earn enough to meet the family's needs and wants.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Rama

texts.en:
Rama is a married man with two children, both attending school. He lives in his own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His [greatest] monthly expense is school fees.

For the past ten years, Rama has been operating a palm wine business, selling to neighbors and passersby. His major challenge is the high cost of transportation. He dreams of establishing a big pub in the future. With this 40,000 Kenyan shilling loan, he wants to purchase furniture and benches for the customers. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase furniture and benches for the customers.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. She has a multipurpose van, or public utility van, with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos to buy tools for maintenance and pay for gasoline.
 
Gemma has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Gemma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline.

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.en:
Cornelia is separated from her husband and has two school-aged children. She is 36 years old and lives in the village of San Pedro in Pagadian City, Philippines.

Cornelia has a swine fattening business to earn a living. She has been raising this type of animal for over 8 years. While not her sole source of income, Cornelia earns approximately 37,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. She has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP from GDMPC to purchase livestock feed and other supplies to facilitate her animals' growth. 

Cornelia is a new member of GDMPC. This is her first loan taken out from the cooperative. In the future, Cornelia hopes to buy more piglets to raise and sell. She plans to save for future emergencies and for the education of her children to give them a better future. Cornelia expects to borrow again after paying this loan in full to sustain business operations.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en: Emelyn, a 47-year-old married mother of four children, lives in the Philippines where, for the past five years, she has had a shop that sells canned goods, breads, noodles and beverages. A member of HSPFI since 2011, she is requesting a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks, and beverages. In the future, Emelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica, a 39-year-old married mother of one, lives in the Philippines where she has had a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and spices including garlic and onions for the last seven years. A member of HSPFI since 2009, she has requested a loan for PHP 17,000 to buy more snacks, beverages and spices. In the future, Jessica hopes to improve her business.
 .

loans.use: to buy snacks, beverages & spices.

loans.name: Nada

texts.en:
Since 2007, Nada, a 44-year-old married mother of four, has been the proud owner of a small grocery store selling sweets, soft drinks, canned products, vegetables, ice cream and tobacco. Because the store is a very important source of family income, Nada is requesting a loan of $1500 from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase her purchases of new oil, sugar, rice, canned products and tobacco, as well as a power generator to provide electricity when it's not available to keep the refrigerators and freezers working. 

This will be Nada's first Kiva loan, and we note that she is working hard on expanding her business and increasing her capital.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store and a power generator.

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen  is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Ellen  has a vegetable garden where she harvests & sells vegetables like eggplants & string beans. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan of PHP 16,000 to buy fertilizers for the vegetable garden.

Ellen  has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Ellen  hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her vegetable garden.

loans.name: Mose

texts.en:
Mose is a married woman with seven children all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children.

For the past ten years she has operated a vegetable shop, selling to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenges are seasonality and high cost of transportation. She dreams of purchasing a bigger "shamba" (piece of land) to plant more vegetables in future.

With Kshs. 30,000 she wants to purchase a piece of land for growing vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase a piece of land for growing vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Hadijah

texts.en:
Hadijah is a married woman with six children who attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and school fees.

For the past two years she has operated a retail shop business, selling to neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase bags of sugar for resale. She decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bags of sugar for resale.

loans.name: Balyeijukira Kiseke Group

texts.en: Sarah is 40 years old and married. She has 5 children, ages 11 to 21, who live in her house in Hoima, Uganda. She has been operating a bar and shop for 10 years. Sarah's business is now affected by the challenge of people who pay their debts late. Her dream is to have a big bar. Sarah needs a loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 40 years old and married with four children between 17 and 9 years old. She lives in her own house in Hoima, Uganda. She has been in the produce business for six years. She has the challenge of price fluctuations, which affect her business profits and her dream is to own a food store. Beatrice needs the loan to buy maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell .

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn  is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children.
 
Merlyn  has a shop that sells green and yellow bananas per kilogram. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for PHP 14,000 to buy yellow and green bananas for resale.

Merlyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Merlyn  hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy yellow and green bananas for sale.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 34 years old, married and has four children one of whom works.

Ahmad has been an owner of a food market since 2007, selling soft drinks, juices, cheese and dairy products. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. 

Ahmad decided to apply for $3000 loan in order to buy a generator and a fridge and to make a sliding door for his market. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to buy a generator and a fridge and to make a sliding door for his market.

loans.name: Anselma

texts.en:
Anselma is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children.
 
Anselma has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for six years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 14,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Anselma has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Anselma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane  is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children.
 
Jane has a pigpen that sells mature pigs. She has had this business for two years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy animal feed for the pigs. 

Jane has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Jane hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fresh fish to fry for resale.

loans.name: Umazi

texts.en:
Umazi is a married woman with six children, five of whom attend school while one is still young for school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past two years she has operated a retail shop, selling to neighbors and passersby. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation. She dreams of having her own wholesale business.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase bags of sugar, wheat flour and maize flour. She decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bags of sugar, wheat flour and maize flour.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 22 years old, single and lives with eight family members two of whom work. 

Ali has been an owner of a glassware shop since 2008, selling mirrors, and different kinds of glassware. He gained his experience from his father who had has a good reputation and a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His shop is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He is requesting an $1800 loan in order to purchase a tricycle truck that will allow him to transport glass and goods. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a tricycle truck that will allow him to transport glass and goods.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her children.

For the past two years she has operated a boutique shop, selling to neighbors and friends. Her major challenges are seasonality and transportation. She dreams of having a wholesale boutique in the future.  

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase boutique items and cloth materials to increase her stock. She decide to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase boutique items and cloth materials to increase her stock.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children.
 
Elsie has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Elsie has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Asi

texts.en:
Asi sells cooking utensils and slippers at Kukwa. She attained a junior high level of education. She is married and has three children. 

Asi has been selling utensils for five years. She assists her partner to take care of the home. 

Her loan will be used to acquire more cooking utensils for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save toward building a shop.

loans.use: to acquire more cooking utensils for resale.

loans.name: Eshonkul

texts.ru: Эшонкул проживает в районе Шахритус. Ему 46 лет. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Его жена работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Сам он занимается выращиванием овощей. В этой области Эшонкул более 5 лет. Кредит берет для закупа семян и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Eshonkul lives in the Shahrituz district.  He is 46 years old, married and has four children.  His wife works at a dekhan farm.  Eshonkul is involved in growing vegetables.  He has been in this business for over five years.  Eshonkul is requesting this loan for the purchase of seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Manon

texts.ru: Манон целеустремленный и добросовестный человек. Он женат и любящий отец 5 детей. Он занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственный культур более 11 лет.  Манон в основном  выращивает пшеницу. Он хочет получить больше доходов от данного бизнеса и усердно работает, чтобы осуществить все свои мечту. Он хочет устроит своих детей в университетах и построит дом для своего сына. Манон запрашивает на сумму 2350$ США. Он хочет использовать займ для покупки семена и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Manon is a goal-oriented and conscientious person.  He is married and is a loving father of five children.  He has been involved in growing agricultural crops for over 11 years.  Manon primarily grows wheat.  He wants to increase his income from this business and works hard in order to achieve his dream.  He wants to place his children into universities and to build a house for his son.  Manon is requesting a loan in the sum of $2350.  He wants to use this loan to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Asi

texts.en:
Asi is divorced and has three children. 

She sells garden eggs, peppers and other vegetables in large and small quantities at Abura. The income she makes from her sales is used to provide the basic needs of the home. 

She will use the loan to procure more vegetables to retail. With the new proceeds from her expanded business, Asi plans to reinvest for further growth.

loans.use: to procure more vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena is a widow taking care of 5 dependents. She retails in plantain, garden eggs (similar to eggplant) and other kinds of vegetables at Abura, which she has done for 16 years. She wishes to increase her sales, so a loan will be used to buy bags of garden eggs to supply in bulk to her customers. With the new increase from her extended business, Abena plans to reinvest back into her business for further growth.

loans.use: to buy bags of garden eggs to supply in bulk to her customers.

loans.name: Kudus

texts.ru:
Кудус честный, добросовестный и целеустремленный человек. Он женат и у них 5 детей. 
У него очень большая семья и много расходов. Для содержания своей семьи он начал заниматься скотоводством вот уже более 31 лет и у него очень богатый опыт в этом бизнесе. Кроме этого Кудус выращивает картошку и пшеницу для продажи. Он содержит скот в количестве 3 голов коров и 24 голов овца.  За полученный прибыль, он хочет построит дом для младшего сына. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 3000$ США для покупки скота для того, чтобы откармливать и продавать их. Таким образом, он хочет получить побольше дохода.
texts.en: Kudus is an honest, conscientious and goal-oriented person.  He is married and has five children.  He has a large family and a lot of expenses.  Kudus became involved in animal husbandry in order to support his family and has now been in this business for over 31 years.  He has a rich experience in this business.  Besides this, Kudus grows potatoes and wheat for sale.  He owns three cows and 24 sheep.  He wants to use his profit to build a house for his youngest son.  Kudus is requesting a loan in the sum of $3000 for the purchase of livestock in order to fatten it up and sell it.  He plans to earn more money by doing that.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Pridon

texts.en:
Pridon is a farmer from the village of Zeda Leghva, Western Georgia. He is 41 years old, married and lives with his big family: wife – Natela, 19 year old daughter, 18 year old son and parents (retired). Pridon’s daughter is a student. 

Pridon works as worker in the village. At the same time, he is busy with the family agricultural business. He grows tangerines and maize on a family-owned 0.5 hectare piece of land. Pridon sells harvested products at the local market. Total average monthly income of the family, including Pridon’s parents’ pensions, is 700 Laris. 

Pridon has requested credit for two reasons. With one part of the funds, he will purchase a milk cow. Natela will produce cheese and sell it locally. Also, he will get calves after a year and raise them. With the smaller part of the credit, Pridon will pay the high-school study fees for his daughter. Initiating of the dairy farm will give additional income to the family, which will allow them to finance their children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow and to pay study fees for his child.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bags of plantain to sell.

loans.name: Gwaya

texts.en:
Gwaya is a married man. He has 3 children, all of whom attend school. The family lives at their own house that has neither electricity, nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for his children.

For the past 5 years, he has operated a goat meat business, selling to butcher men and neighbors. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. Gwaya dreams of owning a butcher shop in the future.

With the KES 20,000.00 he wants to purchase more goats for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more meat.

loans.name: Banju

texts.en:
Banju is a married man who has no children. He and his wife live at their own house that has neither electricity, nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are electricity bills and food for the family.

For the past three years, Banju has operated a goatmeat business, selling to butcher shop operators and neighbors. Banju faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He dreams of expanding his business in the future.

With the KES 20,000.00 he wants to purchase goats. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase goats.

loans.name: Mame

texts.en: Mame is a single parent taking care of 2 children. She has been through junior high school. Mame sells varieties of items such as raw rice, beans, cooking oil, tomatoes and clothing at Kukwa, which she has done for 10 years. Demand for her clothing has increased and she needs a loan to buy other types of clothing to resell. Her future plan towards her business is to build a shop one day. Any profit that will be realized from the business will be reinvested back into the business and to build a shop.

loans.use: to buy other types of clothing to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more plantain and gari to sell.

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa has received senior high education. She is divorced and has 3 children. She is responsible for the well-being of her home. 

Adwoa sells doughnuts, utensils and clothes at Kukwa, by moving from one area to another. She has been in this clothing business for some time now. Her loan will be used to buy clothing to resell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards building a shop.

loans.use: to buy clothing to resell.

loans.name: Sanavbar

texts.ru: Санавбар проживает в городе Истаравшан. Возраст, 43 года. Она замужем. Имеет двоих детей. Ее муж занимается бизнесом, а сын находится в Российской Федерации на заработках. Сама Санавбар занимается торговлей. Она на центральном рынке города имеет торговую точку, где продает ткани и платки. Этим видом деятельности занимается 20 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения разных видов тканей и платков.
texts.en: Sanavbar lives in the city of Istaravshan.  She is 43 years old, married and has two children.  Her husband is involved in business, and son works in the Russian Federation.  Sanavbar is involved in retail sales.  She has a retail outlet in the city center, where she sells fabrics and scarves.  She has been in this business for 20 years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of various types of fabrics and scarves.

loans.use: to buy various types of fabrics and scarves

loans.name: Mushtak

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 29 years old, married and has two children.
Mushtak has owned a store selling women’s accessories and clothing since 2004. He has good experience in this field and a deep understanding of local consumers. He has a good reputation and is well known in his area. His store is situated in a crowded area so there is a good number of customers passing by.
Mushtak has decided to apply for a loan of $2,100 in order to renovate and fix his store’s walls and floors and buy more inventory. He is aiming to earn more profit so that he is able to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to renovate and fix his store’s walls and floors and to buy more inventory.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba is married and has 7 children. Her husband is a security man. She buys fresh fish from the market and comes home to fry them for resale at Kukwa. Some kenkey sellers, instead of buying fish to fry themselves, sometimes prefer to buy from people like her to sell with their kenkey. Some kenkey sellers also, because of the stress accompanied with frying of the fish, will to buy from someone like Aba. 

Aba also wants to increase her sales by acquiring a loan of GHS 500 (Ghanian Cedi) to be able to meet the demands of her customers. Aba uses her income to assist her husband to feed the family. Aba will use the loan to purchase more fresh fish to fry and sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba plans to invest in her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh fish to fry, to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to obtain a variety of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is married and has seven children. Her husband is a gardener. She sells soaps and different types of toothpastes at Kukwa by moving from one area to another. Cecilia assists her husband in taking care of the home. She will use the loan to purchase more toothpaste to sell. With the profits from her expanded business, Cecilia plans to reinvest for further growth.

loans.use: to purchase toothpaste to sell.

loans.name: Mahmood

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 63 years old, married and has one child who works.
Mahmood has owned a food market selling soft drinks, juices, cheese and dairy products since 2003. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. 
Mahmood has decided to apply for a loan of $2,500 in order to buy an electric diesel generator and add more foodstuffs to his market. He is aiming to earn more profits so that he is able to provide a better life for his family.

loans.use: to buy an electric diesel generator and to add more foodstuffs to his market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and rice.

loans.name: Ochirbat

texts.en:
Ochirbat is 31 years old, married, and has two children.  They live in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.. He is a taxi driver who tries to work hard. He started his business in 2007 and has been able to buy a small plot of land in his living district with his earnings. His taxi business is the main source of income for his family. 

Orchirbat's car is very old and dangerous to use. Therefore, he is requesting a loan to purchase spare parts to renovate his taxi.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his taxi renovation.

loans.name: Tengiz

texts.en:
Tengiz is 47 years old, married, and has two children, both of whom attend school.  He is from the village of Chekhedana, West Georgia. Tengiz and his wife are running a family agricultural business, which is the only source of income for the family. Tengiz grows 1,000 nut and tangerine trees on the family- owned 0.5 hectare of land. They sell harvested products locally to wholesalers. Their total average monthly income is 280 Laris. 

Tengiz is requesting a loan to purchase nuts from wholesalers for an inexpensive price. He will process them and sell in the spring for a higher price. Tengiz will use the profit for financing the education of his children.

loans.use: to purchase nuts for resale.

loans.name: Untie

texts.en: Untie sells maize and banku at Kukwa. She has been through senior high school. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a security man. Untie has been selling maize for 6 years. She supports her husband to feed, clothe and educate her children. Her loan will be used to buy bulk maize for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards the university education of her children.

loans.use: to buy bulk maize for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his shop.

loans.name: Asatullo

texts.ru: Асатулло честный, целеустремленный и добросовестный человек. Он занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур более 12 лет. Он выбрал данный бизнес для того, чтобы обеспечить свою жену и четверо детей и содержать их в хороших условиях жизни. Он выращивает картошку и морковь для продажи, а также часть урожая использует на нужды своего дома, который позволяет ему, уменьшит расходы на покупки овощей. Кроме этого он занимается откормом скота, и он содержит их за счет кормом произведенных самим. Асатулло хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить большой прибыль. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 3000$ США для покупки коров и овца. Прибыль, который он планирует от данного бизнеса, он хочет использовать на стройки своего дома. Он заранее благодарен всем  кто поддерживает его.
texts.en: Asatullo is an honest, goal-oriented and conscientious person.  He has been involved in growing agricultural crops for over 12 years.  He chose this business in order to support his wife and four children and provide a good quality of life for them.  He grows potatoes and carrots for sale and also uses part of his harvest for his household needs, which allows him to reduce expenses of purchasing vegetables.  Besides this business, Asatullo is involved in fattening up livestock and keeps the livestock with the feed that he grows himself.  Asatullo wants to expand his business and make a large profit.  He is requesting a loan in the sum of $3000 for the purchase of cows and sheep.  He plans to use the profit from this business to build his house.  He thanks everyone who supports him in advance.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi sells salted fish and palm oil at Kukwa market near Abura. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a driver. She, as part of her responsibilities, assists her husband to take care of the home. Her loan will be used to buy salted fish. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy salted fish

loans.name: Bakitnur

texts.ru: Бакинтур  - 52-летний фермер из села Тюп. Женат и воспитывает 2 сыновей. До распада Советского Союза Бакитнур работал ветеринаром в колхозе, а после развала  решил начать свой бизнес в животноводстве.   Начав с суммы  в  20,000 сом (KGS), Бакитнур сумел развить свой бизнес с ежемесячным доходом в сумме около 28,000 сом (KGS).  В целях  дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бакитнур обратился в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) для закупа бычков для откорма. Доходы от кредита он планирует использовать для ремонта дома и последующего увеличения поголовья.
texts.en: Bakitnur is a 52-year-old farmer from the Tuyp village.  He is married and is raising two sons.  Prior to the break-up of the Soviet Union, Bakitnur had worked as a veterinarian at a collective farm and then decided to start his own animal husbandry business after the break-up.  Starting with a sum of 20,000 som (KGS), Bakitnur was able to develop his business to yield a monthly income of about 28,000 som (KGS).  In order to further develop his business, he requested a loan in the sum of 80,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy calves for fattening up.  He plans to use the income from this loan for repair his house and further increasing livestock headcount.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 10 sacks of corn

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a small pick up car

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is a seamstress and at the same time smokes fish for sale at Kukwa. She has received a junior-high education.  She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a mason. Ama has been smoking fish for 3 years now. She supports her husband in educating, feeding and clothing her children. 

Her loan will be used to buy extra batches of fish to smoke for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy extra batches of fish to smoke for resale.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 39 years old, married and blessed with two children.  For a living, he has a transport business.  He has been in the taxi business for five years and has employed five people to assist him.  He was able to start dairy farming after getting a loan from Faulu Kenya.  Now, his farming business earns him extra income.  He has also managed to build his own house.  David is very grateful to Faulu Kenya because of his achievements.

David hopes to provide a good education for his children.  He has requested 50, 000 Kenya shillings to service his vehicle.

loans.use: To service his vehicle

loans.name: Berdimurod

texts.ru: Бердимурод проживает в районе Шахритус. Ему 51 год. Он женат. У него шестеро детей. Его жена домохозяйка, а сын находится в Российской Федерации. Сам Бердимурод имеет высшее педагогическое образование. По профессии он проработал 10 лет. На сегодняшний день Бердимурод занимается растениеводством. При доме он имеет участок земли, где выращивает овощи для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается 7 лет. Кредит берет для закупа семян и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Berdimurod lives in the Shahrituz district.  He is 51 years old, married and has six children.  His wife is a homemaker, and son is in the Russian Federation.  Berdimurod has a higher pedagogical education.  He spent ten years working in his profession.  Today, Berdimurod is involved in agriculture.  He has a plot of land by his house, where he grows vegetables for sale.  He has been involved in this business for 7 years.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Vazha

texts.en:
Vazha is a farmer from the village Likhauri, in the Ozurgeti District, West Georgia. He is 63 years old and lives with his wife, Shogik,  his 37 year-old son, his daughter-in-law, his 2 year-old grand-daughter, and his 86 year-old mother. 

Vazha works as a tractor driver in the village. At the same time, he is actively involved in the family agricultural business. In particular, the family grows maize, citrus and kiwi (120 trees) on his family-owned 0.7 hectare land. He sells harvested product locally. Average monthly income of the family is 770 Laris. 

With the requested credit, Vazha will purchase fertilizers for the maize cornfield and the citrus garden. After fertilizing, he will get a good harvest and sell it for an appropriate price. Also, he will plant additional kiwi trees and he will enclose the kiwi garden. Vazha plans to reinvest the increase in income in further development of the kiwi farm, as it is profitable.
