loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, and materials for enclosing his kiwi garden.

loans.name: Naftal

texts.en:
Naftal is 31 years old, married, and blessed with two children, ages 2 and 6.  He runs a retail shop so as to earn a living for his family. He has engaged in the business for eleven years.  So far, he has expanded his business and has employed two people.  He decided to leave his previous employment and went into business so that he would earn enough income to meet his family’s demand.

Naftal has been able to increase his business stock with his previous loans from Faulu Kenya.  He hopes to expand his shop in the future.  He has requested 60,000 Kenya shillings to buy sugar, cooking fat, rice, soap and maize flour.

loans.use: To buy sugar, cooking fat, rice, soap and maize flour.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 33 years old, married, and blessed with two children.  To earn a living, he runs a retail shop. He has operated the business for four years, with one employee.  He has retained his business through the financial support from Faulu Kenya.  
His desire is to open other outlets of his business in five years.  He has requested 70,000 Kenya shillings to buy a cow and a water tank because he wants to start up dairy farming.

loans.use: To buy a cow and a water tank

loans.name: Yuldosh

texts.ru: Юлдош женат и у них трое детей. Он имеет сельское фермерское хозяйство. Он выращивает картошку, морковь, пшеницу и другие виды сельхоз культур. Кроме этого он занимается откормом скота. Более 21 лет он занимается этим бизнесом и за эти годы он старался расширить свой бизнес и усердно работал над этим. Он хотел бы получить займ для покупки скота с целью расширения бизнеса. Он хочет получить хороший прибыль от данного бизнеса и планирует, вложит часть денег на пополнения оборотного капитала, а с другой частью он хочет сыграть свадьбу своего внука.
texts.en: Yuldosh is married and has three children.  He has an agricultural farm business.  He grows potatoes, carrots, wheat and other types of crops.  Besides this, he is involved in fattening up livestock.  He has been involved in this business for over 21 years and, over these years, tried to expand his business and has been working hard at it.  He wants to obtain a loan for the purchase of livestock in order to expand his business.  Yuldosh wants to make a good profit from this business and plans to invest some money into his revolving capital and some into holding a wedding for his grandson.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Frashiah

texts.en:
Frashiah, a business-lady who sells new and second-hand household goods such as mattresses and beds, has operated her business for over ten years, employing two people to assist her. She also farms to earn additional income.

Frashiah's membership in Faulu Kenya has taught her business management skills that have enabled her to improve her enterprise, and she hopes to expand her business premises within five years. She is now requesting a loan of 70,000 Kenya shillings to buy more second-hand furniture.

loans.use: to buy second-hand furniture.

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.ru: Дилором жительница района Шахритус. Ей 25 лет. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Она занимается растениеводством. В основном она выращивает овощи для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа семян лука и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Dilorom lives in the Shahrituz district.  She is 25 years old, married and has four children.  She is involved in agriculture and primarily grows vegetables for sale.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of onion seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy onion seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Murtazo

texts.ru: Муртазо честный и добрый человек. Он женат и любящий отец 3 детей. Его жена домохозяйка и она иногда помогает мужу. Муртазо занимается выращиванием сельскохозяйственных культур, а также занимается откормом скота. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес и максимизировать свой прибыль. Муртазо хочет видит своих детей в будущем как образованными и воспитанными людьми. Муртазо запрашивает займ в размере 3000$ США для покупки семена, минеральных удобрений и скота. Прибыль, который приносить ему данный бизнес, он планирует использовать часть его на учебу своего сына, а другую часть на расширения бизнеса. Он заранее благодарен за Кива и Кива кредиторы за их поддержку и милосердие.
texts.en: Murtazo is an honest and kind person.  He is married and is a loving father of three children.  His wife is a homemaker and she sometimes helps her husband.  Murtazo is involved in growing agricultural crops and fattening up livestock.  He wants to expand his business and maximize his profit.  Murtazo wants to see his children in the future as educated and well-mannered people.  He is requesting a loan in the sum of $3000 for the purchase of seeds, mineral fertilizers and livestock.  He plans to use the profit from this loan partially to pay for his son's education and partially for expanding his business.  He thanks Kiva and Kiva creditors in advance for their support and mercy.

loans.use: to buy seeds, mineral fertilizers and livestock

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy 30 simple African print cloth outfits and 15 African prints on damask.

loans.name: Mujeres Con Decisiones A Trabajar Group

texts.es:
18 mujeres D. la ciudad D. Lambaré se unieron con el propósito D. generar mayores ingresos para sus familias. Ellas son amigas y vecinas D. esa ciudad que buscan no solo el crecimiento D. cada una D. ellas sino también servir a su comunidad en la forma que ellas puedan. Actualmente ellas se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto dentro del segundo ciclo del programa D. mujeres emprendedoras D. la Fundación.
Una D. las miembros es la señora Nilce, ella se dedica a la venta D. bebidas, comenta que gracias a su negocio ella ha logrado salir adelante y mantener a toda su familia. Cuenta que tiene mucha demanda, en especial los fines D. semana. Uno D. sus proyectos es ampliar su negocio, para que D. esa forma pueda tener mayor capacidad para almacenar las bebidas, como así también para exhibir y ofrecer a sus clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. bebidas, como ser cervezas, vinos, whiskys y otros para abastecer su local y D. esa forma cumplir con la demanda D. sus clientes. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
Eighteen women in the city of Lambaré joined one another with the intent of generating more money for their families. They are friends and neighbors who wish not only for their own individual growth but also to serve their community in whatever way they can. They are currently working very happily with their second loan for entrepreneurial women through the Foundation.

One of the members is Mrs. Nilce. She works selling beverages. She shares that thanks to her business, she has gotten ahead and supported her whole family. She shares that there is a lot of demand, especially on the weekends. One of her projects is to expand her business, so that she can have more space to store beverages and also exhibit them and offer them to her customers.

She is asking for the loan to buy beverages like beer, wine, whiskey and others to stock her store and supply for her customers' demands. She is thankful to the Foundation for the opportunity that they are providing her.

loans.use: Buy beverages, such as beer, wine, whiskey, and others to stock their store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.ru: Светлане 53 года, вдова и имеет взрослую дочь. Светлана закончила Кыргызский Государственный университет по специальности преподаватель истории обществоведения и долгое время проработала в местной школе – интернате. К сожалению, зарплата не позволяла покрыть все расходы ее семьи и Светлана решила заняться собственным бизнесом в торговле. Светлана занимается реализацией детской одежды, так как традиционно на нее существует высокий спрос. Для дальнейшего расширения ассортимента за счет детской обуви, Светлана обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS). Часть доходов от кредита она планирует направить на проведение ремонта дома. В будущем, Светлана мечтает объездить весь Кыргызстан и увидеть все достопримечательности своей страны.
texts.en: Svetlana is 53 years old, a widow and has a adult daughter.  Svetlana graduated from the Kyrgyz State University with a social sciences teaching major and spent a long time working at the local boarding school.  Unfortunately, her salary did not cover all of her family's expenses, and Svetlana decided to start her own retail business.  She is involved in selling children's clothing because it is traditionally in high demand.  In order to further expand her merchandise selection by adding children's shoes, Svetlana requested a loan in the sum of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company.  She plans to use some of the income from the loan to make repairs to her home.  In the future, Svetlana dreams of traveling the entire Kyrgyzstan and see all of the attractions of her country.

loans.use: to broaden an assortment of goods

loans.name: Ibodat

texts.ru: Ибодат умная и честная женщина.  Она замужем и любящая мать 4 детей. Она занимается купля продажей овощей на местном рынке. Её муж помогает ей по данному бизнесу, и они вместе дружно работает. Ибодат хочет, чтобы её дети выросли в хороших условиях жизни и стали образованными человеками. Этот бизнес приносит ей стабильный доход и с прибылью, который она получила от данного бизнеса, позволила ей выдать замуж свою дочку. Ибодат  хотела бы получит кредит для покупки овощи, который позволяет ей расширить свой бизнес и получить желаемой прибыли.
texts.en: Ibodat is a smart and honest woman.  She is married and is a loving mother of four children.  She is involved in buying and selling vegetables at the local market.  Her husband helps her in this business, and they work well together.  Ibodat wants her children to grow up in good living conditions and became educated people.  This business brings her a stable income and profit, which she got from this business, allowed her to marry off her daughter.  Ibodat wants to obtain a loan for the purchase of vegetables, which would let her expand her business and make a desired profit.

loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
In the photo is Susan, 52, married and a mother of four.  She does dairy farming to earn a living.  She has been farming for three years has four workers who assist her in her tasks.  She was previously involved in horticultural farming. 
 
Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to get business loans which she has used to boost her business.  She needs 100,000 Kes to buy two dairy cows.

loans.use: To buy two dairy cows.

loans.name: Bonna

texts.en:
Bonna is 38 years old, married and has three children.  For seven years, she has been practicing dairy farming.  Besides this, she grows coffee so as to generate more income for her family.  So far she has serviced three loans from Faulu Kenya which has helped her to improve her business.  

She has requested 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy dairy cows.

loans.use: To buy dairy cows.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 71 years old, married and blessed with eight grown-up children.  He has been operating a retail shop mainly selling sodas for five years and has employed five people.  He also does farming to supplement his income.  Previously, he was involved in the transport business.

He testifies that through Faulu Kenya, he has managed to build rental houses which generate more income for his family.  He hopes that his children will all become financially independent in five years.

He has requested 70,000 Kenya shillings to add to his stock of sodas.

loans.use: To add to his stock of sodas.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 25 years old, married and blessed with a three-year-old child.  He operates a retail shop so as to earn a living for his family.  In addition, he practices dairy farming for more income generation. 

Since he became a member of Faulu Kenya, he has learnt how to save his money.  He has also been able to access business loans easily which he has used to improve his business.

He hopes to grow his shop into wholesale in the future.  He has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to add to his stock of sugar, salt, sodas and cooking fat.

loans.use: To add to his stock of sugar, salt, sodas and cooking fat.

loans.name: Santa Maria Group

texts.es:
El Comité Santa María 2 es un grupo de la ciudad de Curuguaty integrado por 11 mujeres, se encuentran actualmente en el segundo ciclo del Programa Comité de Mujeres de la Fundación Paraguaya. Dicen que ellas se unieron con el propósito de generar mayores ingresos para sus familias y de esa forma poder seguir creciendo y abrirse camino en la vida.
La señora Liliana se dedica a la venta de perfumes de todo tipo, gracias a lo cual puede obtener los ingresos necesarios para afrontar los gastos diarios de la familia. Comenta que es un negocio muy rentable ya que tiene muchos clientes. Una de sus metas es tener algún día una perfumería donde pueda ofrecer su productos de una mejor manera.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de perfumes, lociones y otros con lo cual podrá cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por el apoyo que esta le da, pues de obtener el crédito le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
The Santa Maria María 2 Group of the city of Curuguaty is made up of 11 women. They are currently with their second loan cycle from the Women's Program Group of the Paraguayan Foundation (Fundación Paraguaya). They say that they got together with the intention of generating more income for their families, and in this way to keep growing and creating opportunities in their lives.

Mrs. Liliana works selling all kinds of perfume. Thanks to this business she can earn enough money to provide for her family's daily expenses. She shares that her business is very profitable since she now has a lot of customers. One of her goals is to someday have a perfume shop where she can offer her products in a better way. She is asking for a loan to buy perfume, lotion, and other items so she can supply for her customers' demand. She is thankful to the Fundación Paraguaya for the support they provide her, because this loan will help her greatly.

loans.use: buy perfume and lotion for resale

loans.name: Leonel De Jesus

texts.es:
Entusiasmo y energía positiva son las palabras que caracterizan a Leonel quien desde hace muchos años se gana la vida siendo comerciante, actualmente tiene un restaurante ubicado en caldas, un municipio del departamento de Antioquia, allí trabaja diariamente con la ilusión de llegar a tener un mejor futuro, para él y su hermana quien le ayuda con la producción de comida en el restaurante.

Juntos han sacado su negocio adelante, y han luchado con gran positivismo para lograr sus metas, sueñan con abrir otro restaurante donde generar más empleos directos, un negocio que no sólo les brinde estabilidad económica si no que también le brinde la oportunidad de ayudarle a otras personas. Sin embargo hoy tiene un propósito más inmediato, comprar surtido e insumos para su restaurante, así tendrán mejor capacidad de producción, incrementando las ventas, sus ingresos, y mejorando su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Enthusiasm and positive energy are the words that describe Leonel, who has earned his livelihood for many years as a merchant. He currently has a restaurant in Caldas, a town in the Department of Antioquia. Leonel works every day with the intent of having a better future for himself and his sister, who helps him with preparing the food in the restaurant.

Together they have been able to move their business forward. They have strived to achieve their goals with a positive attitude. Leonel dreams of opening another restaurant so that more jobs can be created. He hopes to have a business that not only provides economic stability, but also creates opportunities to help other people. However, today his immediate goal is to buy ingredients and supplies for his restaurant so that he can improve his production capacity, increase his sales, improve his income, and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies for his restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to renovate his house.

loans.name: Kayunga Market Women's Group A

texts.en:
Many people like Cate enjoy munching away on fresh fruit and vegetables. Cate figured selling something she herself is partial to would be a worthwhile and an enjoyable venture. It was 20 years ago when she took root in this business. She plies her trade in Kayunga. What's her secret and what unravels her longevity?

Cate says when all is said and done, only hard work, determination and perseverance have kept her business afloat. She says she began her involvement in this trade with no experience but casting her mind back, she says the fact that many people consumed fresh fruit and vegetables back in the day came in really handy.

Cate took stock of the fact that her business would benefit more if she started planting her own fruits and vegetables. She embarked on fruit and vegetable farming some years later and to a greater magnitude, it has lent countenance to her business transactions. Cate sells fresh pumpkins, sweet bananas, onions, tomatoes, apples, oranges, etc. Monthly she says her sales profits add up to Uganda shillings 200,000.

Cate reckons she will at length be able to earn more once she gets this loan. Cate says she is to use her Kiva loan to purchase more high value pumpkin, tomato and pineapple seeds to replant. She says if she starts harvesting on  a bigger scale, her odds of further financial success are in the ascendant.

loans.use: to purchase more high value pumpkin, tomato and pineapple seeds to replant.

loans.name: Joany Arlez

texts.es:
A sus 43 años de edad Joany se considera un microempresario luchador que ha trabajado para sacar sus 4 hijos adelante, ya que sus condiciones económicas no han sido las mejores, es un soñador que vive con la ilusión de brindarle a su familia un mejor futuro. Anteriormente era un comerciante en su pueblo natal, pero quiso emprender un nuevo camino con su familia y llegó a Itagüí, un municipio del departamento de Antioquia donde tiene una tienda que les ha dado el sustento familiar durante 6 años.

Joany sueña con poder incrementar las utilidades y sabe que para ello debe tener mayor capital de trabajo para comprar el surtido en grandes cantidades y así obtener un descuento en la compra y ganancias en la venta, pero el actualmente no cuenta con este capital, por lo que solicita un préstamo que le ayude a ir cumpliendo paso a paso sus sueños de darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
At 43 years of age, Joany is considered to be a determined small businessman who has worked to see his four children get ahead. Even though his financial conditions have not been the best, he dreams of providing his family a better future. Joany previously was a merchant in his hometown, but he wanted to travel down a new path with his family so they moved to Itagüí, a town in the Department of Antioquia. He has managed a store for the past six years in order to sustain his family.

Joany dreams of increasing his profits. He knows that he must have more operating capital so that he can restock in larger quantities and obtain the necessary discounts that will help him earn more from his sales. Since he does not have the capital at the moment, he is requesting a loan that will help him take the next step toward his dream of providing his children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Francisca Del Socorro

texts.es: Francisca Del Socorro tiene 55 años su actividad es la comercialización de prendas de oro y plata. Su mayor desafío ha sido que algunos clientes le solicitan variedad en la elaboración de sus productos y con poco capital no puede realizar estos pedidos. Pero esto no desanima a Francisca por lo que se siente contenta por brindar el mejor servicio. Ella solicito este crédito para la compra de oro laminado, plata, oro y oro blanco. Sueña con incrementar su negocio cada día mas.
texts.en:
Francisca Del Socorro is 55 years old and sells jewelry made of gold and silver. Her greatest challenge is when some of her customers request a variety of these products when she has little capital to fulfill their orders. However, this does not discourage Francisca since she is pleased to provide better service.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy gold plating, silver, gold, and white gold. Her dream is to increase her business each day.

loans.use: to buy gold plating, silver, gold, and white gold.

loans.name: Glenda Dalila

texts.es: Glenda Dalila D. veintidós años D. edad vive con su compañero D. vida en casa propia. Ella se dedica a la venta D. comida en el lugar D. su residencia, es muy conocida en la localidad pues los platillos que prepara tienen un sabor inigualable prepara ricos desayunos y almuerzos, todo la comida es D. muy buena calidad. Glenda tiene buenos precios  y su lugar D. trabajo es totalmente higiénico, además el servicio que ofrece es excelente, siempre los recibe con gran alegría y amabilidad; para ella la motivación D. superarse la ayudó a comenzar pero ahora el habito D. trabajar le permite continuar, quiere ver crecer su negocio y no cuenta con dinero propio y es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar materia prima granos básicos, carnes, verduras, lácteos, embutidos, entre otros que compra semana a semana para la preparación D. sus ricos platillos. Glenda Dalila tiene la confianza D. que su trabajo le permitirá darle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Glenda Dalila is 22 years old and owns a house where she lives with her life partner. She sells food from her home and is known locally for her dishes that have a unique flavor. Glenda prepares delicious breakfasts and lunches. All of her food is of high quality. She offers good prices and her work area is kept completely sanitary. In the addition, the service she offers is excellent since she always welcomes her customers with great joy and kindness. The motivation to succeed has driven her to press forward, but now she wants her work habits to continue by growing her business. Glenda does not have money of her own, which is why she is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral.

This loan will be used to buy basic grains, meats, vegetables, dairy products, sausages, and other products that she uses week after week for preparing her delicious dishes. Glenda Dalila is confident that her work will allow her to proviD. her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, meats, vegetables, dairy products, sausages, and other products.

loans.name: Divina Misericordia Group

texts.es:
El comité Divina Misericordia se conformo gracias a la iniciativa de una de las miembros del comité. Actualmente cuenta con 12 miembros, y se encuentran en el primer ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya. Ellas se denominan como mujeres luchadoras, trabajadoras que diariamente luchan por el bienestar de sus familias. Ellas han aprendido a valorar la comunicación en el grupo y en la sociedad, son incentivadas a realizar actividades para aumentar más sus ingresos económicos, y para ver el fruto de sus sacrificios están aprendiendo a ahorrar un poco de sus ganancias para usos futuros.
Una de las miembros es la señora Elsi, ella se dedica a la venta de comestibles desde hace ya mucho tiempo, gracias a este trabajo ella ha logrado salir adelante y mantenerse y mantener a su familia. Comenta que tiene una clientela bien definida que siempre compran de ella, ya que siempre le dicen que tiene muy buena sazón.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carne, pollo verduras y otros para la elaboración de los alimentos que venderá. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le brinda.
texts.en:
The Divina Misericordia committee was formed thanks to the initiative of one of the committee members. Currently it has 12 members and is in the first cycle of the women entrepreneurs program of Fundación Paraguaya. They define themselves as fighting women, hard workers that fight daily for the well-being of their families. They have learned to value the communication in the group and in society. They are motivated to undertake activities that will augment more their monetary income and, to see the fruits of their sacrifices, are learning to save part of their income for future uses.
One of the members is Elsi. She has sold food for a long time already. Thanks to this work, she has managed to get ahead and support herself and her family. She says that she has a well-defined customer base that always buys from her, since they always tell her that she is an excellent cook.
She is requesting the loan to buy meat, chicken, vegetables and other items to prepare the food that she will sell. She is grateful to the Foundation for the opportunity that it provides her.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, vegetables and other items to prepare food.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase medical equipment and supplies

loans.name: Kayunga Market Women's Group B

texts.en:
Owning a business is a worthwhile proposition that many people have of late been eager to explore. From the estimation of 28-year-old Esther, it carries a whole lot of meaning and brings dividends that one would not enjoy while in formal employment.

Esther, a happy-go-lucky mother of two set forth in her pub business a year ago. She operates from Kayunga, a stone's throw away from Kampala. She had gotten disillusioned with the red tape manifest in formal employment.

Esther says from the day she started working, the thought of being her own boss always crossed her mind. She invariably wanted to have the leverage to make her own decisions. What has helped Esther in periods of uncertainty has been her ability to look on the bright side of things. A pub is a profitable venture so if one is painstaking in his or her plans and adds a sense of shrewdness, they are bound to reap big.

Esther sells both hard and soft beverages at her pub. Monthly, her sales profits add up to Ugandan shillings 350,000. Esther’s group is on their 5th loan with Pearl Micro-finance. Esther also ekes out a side income from farming. She says she will use her loan to purchase more crates of soft and hard drinks to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more crates of soft and hard drinks to resell.

loans.name: Justine's Group

texts.en:
Justine's group is comprised of three hard-working women. Justine is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past year, Justine has been working hard to manage her food stall which sells fruits and vegetables. 

To help expand her business, Justine has requested a loan of 250,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more fruits and vegetables and will help Justine to generate greater profits and buy new clothes for herself. Justine hopes that in the future she will be able to open up her own retail shop. 

Justine is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Justine's future prospects by helping her to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Wipalitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “WIPALITAS” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Collpani, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Pamela. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: Costura de mochilas, tienda de mantas, venta de aji por quintal, confección de polleras, venta de ropa personal, ayudante de minibús, costura de chamarras, costura de ropa para miniaturas.
 
La señora Pamela,  indica que es hace cuatro años que integra Pro Mujer  y que ingreso por iniciativa propia. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de costura de chamarras que viene trabajando hace seis años, aprendiendo el mismo de su esposo. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar capital (compra de tela) que adquirirá de la calle Tumusla y posteriormente lo venderá en el departamento de Santa C.. Esta forma de trabajo le permitirá generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros, salud y capacitación.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Wipalitas” is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani Community Center. The group consists of eight members and is led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Pamela. The members of this Communal Bank engage in different businesses in order to get ahead such as making satchels, managing a blanket store, selling peppers in bulk, making skirts, selling staff clothing, working as a minibus assistant, making jackets, and selling doll clothes.

Sra. Pamela says that she joined Pro Mujer four years ago through her own initiative. She currently has a business sewing jackets and has been in this line of work for six years. Pamela learned this trade from her husband.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying fabric that she will acquire on Tumusla Street. Her finished products will eventually be sold in the Department of Santa C.. Working in this manner has enabled her to generate the income that makes it possible for her to support her family. Pamela is in a common-law relationship and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Pamela said that she enjoys the savings, the health services, and the training classes.

loans.use: to buy fabric for making jackets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more livestock.

loans.name: Blanca Omaira

texts.es:
A sus 39 años de edad, Blanca es una emprendedora consagrada a su negocio, una tienda donde vente todos los productos de la canasta familiar. Anteriormente Blanca trabajaba como empleada del servicio doméstico en una casa de familia, pero la señora de la casa y dueña de la tienda se fue del país dejándole a Blanca el negocio, hace 6 años es dueña de esa tienda y trabaja de lunes a sábado con la ilusión de salir adelante. 

Blanca es una luchadora incansable que espera tener más clientes y mas posibilidades económicas para tener su negocio surtido y con gran variedad. Esta emprendedora considera que su trabajo es una bendición ya que ella dispone de su tiempo y puede estar pendiente de su familia.

Actualmente Blanca necesita de un préstamo para comprar mercancía y así incrementar su capacidad de comercialización mejorando proporcionalmente sus ventas. Blanca sueña con llegar a tener una casa propia y por tal motivo trabaja con esmero para poder lograrlo algún día.
texts.en:
Blanca is 39 years old and devoted to her grocery business selling all kinds of basic family supplies. In the past she worked as a servant, but the lady of the house and owner of the business left the country, leaving Blanca the business. So for the last six years she has been owner of the store. She works from Monday to Saturday and is excited about what the future holds.

Blanca is a indefatigable hardworking woman who hopes to have more customers and more economic opportunities so that she can stock her store with a wide variety of items. This entrepreneur believes that work is a blessing allowing her to use her time wisely and be the mainstay of her family.

Now Blanca needs a loan to buy merchandise and in this way expand her business and improve sales. Her dream is to have a house of her own so she takes great care with her work so she can fulfill her dream one day.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Phoebe's Group

texts.en:
Phoebe's group is comprised of 2 hard working women. Phoebe is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past 3 years, Phoebe has been working hard to manage her poultry business, which sells chicken. 

To help expand her business, Phoebe has requested a loan of 350,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more chickens and will help Phoebe to generate greater profits and pay school fees for herself. Phoebe hopes that in the future she will be able to become a teacher. 

Phoebe is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Phoebe’s future prospects by helping her to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Ana Edith

texts.es: Ana Edith D. cuarenta y cuatro años D. edad vive con su compañero D. vida y sus hijos en casa propia al Sur del país y cerca a la zona costera. Ella posee una tienda en su residencia donD. venD. productos D. primera necesidad se ha hecho D. mucha clientela, pues su tienda es la más surtida D. la localidad siempre tiene lo que los clientes necesitan con productos D. muy buena calidad y a precios accesibles además el servicio es excelente; Ana es una mujer muy trabajadora con ganas D. salir adelante para ella la disciplina es el mejor secreto en el trabajo, porque te permite realizar tus metas en el futuro, se ha decidido a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, productos instantáneos, bebidas, pan, entre otros. Ana Edith tiene fe que con su esfuerzo logrará darle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Ana Edith is 41 years old and lives with her husband and children in their own home located in the south of the country near the coast. She runs a store from her house where she sells basic supplies. Ana Edith has many customers as her store is the best stocked in the area. She always has what her customers need and ensures that the quality is very good, the prices are fair, and also that the service is excellent.

Ana is a hardworking woman with the desire to get ahead. In her view discipline is the secret to success  as it allows you to achieve your future goals. She has decided to ask INTEGRAL for a loan so she can buy basic grains, candy, instant foods, drinks, bread etc. Ana Edith doesn't doubt that with sufficient effort she will succeed in providing her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, candy, instant foods, drinks etc

loans.name: Safiya's Group

texts.en:
Safiya's group is comprised of hard working women. Safiya is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past 2 years Safiya has been working hard to manage her clinic which offers health services. 

To help expand her business, Safiya has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more medicine and will help Safiya to generate greater profits and buy new clothes for herself. Safiya hopes that in the future she will be able to become a nurse. 

Safiya is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Safiya's future prospects by helping her to read educational story books.

loans.use: to buy more medicine.

loans.name: Poderoso Imperial Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PODEROSO IMPERIAL” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Candelaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: comercio, producción, servicio y tienda de barrio.

La señora Candelaria,  indica que cuatro años que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por medio de la invitación de una amiga. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio tienda de barrio, que inicio hace años atrás como cafetería
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, etc.), que comprara de las ferias  y lo venderá en su tienda. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es viuda y tiene siete hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The Poderoso Imperial Community Bank is beginning its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of Santiago II group. It is composed of eight members with Señora Candelaria as head of the board of directors. The members work in a variety of enterprises: commerce, production, service and neighbourhood stores.

Señora Candelaria points out that she has worked with Pro Mujer for four years, starting out at the invitation of a friend. She now has a corner store which she started several years ago as a cafeteria.

The loan that she is now seeking will be used as working capital to buy rice, sugar, oil etc. She buys the products in the markets and sells them in her store. The income allows her to support her family as best she can; she is a widow and has seven children. When Candelaria is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the opportunities to learn about health and to obtain loans.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil etc

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more maize flour and other groceries to resell.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es: Teresa D. Jesús vive con su compañero D. vida y sus hijos en una zona muy sencilla del país, ella posee una venta D. ropa D. forma ambulante, venD. variedad D. ropa para dama, caballero, niños y niñas, toda D. muy buena calidad y a precios accesibles se ha hecho D. mucha clientela pues es muy buena vendedora y la ropa es muy bonita, siempre se levanta desD. muy temprano a comerciar el producto para ganarse el pan D. cada día, es una mujer muy emprendedora con grandes metas para el futuro, para ella la posibilidad D. alcanzar esas metas es lo que hace su vida más interesante; le ha solicitado a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar más ropa faldas, pantalones, blusas, camisas, trajes entre otros pues ha aumentado la demanda y no quiere decepcionar a los clientes al no contar con algunas prendas solicitadas. Teresa D. Jesús tiene la esperanza que así logrará darle a su familia seguridad económica.
texts.en: Teresa D. Jesús lives with her partner and children in a very easy-going area of the country. She sells clothes as a street vendor. She sells a variety of clothes for women, men, boys and girls, all of a very good quality and at accessible prices. She has attracted a lot of customers as she is a very good salesperson and the clothes are very pretty. She always gets up very early to market her product and earn her daily bread. She is a very enterprising woman who has big goals for her future. For her, it is the possibility of achieving these goals that make life more interesting. She has asked INTEGRAL for a loan which will allow her to buy more clothes such as skirts, trousers, blouses, shirts and suits among others as demand has increased and she does not want to disappoint her customers by not having some of the items requested. Teresa D. Jesús hopes that in this way she will achieve financial security for her family.

loans.use: to buy skirts, trousers, blouses, shirts and suits.

loans.name: María Antonia

texts.es: María Antonia de cuarenta y cuatro años, tiene una venta de artículos varios como: ropa, relojes, sandalias, imagenes de recuerdos,  entre otros, su negocio tiene mucha demanda en la localidad donde reside, pues la gente siempre encuentra lo que necesita todo de muy buena calidad y a buenos precios, el servicio es excelente ya que María siempre los recibe con una sonrisa en el rostro, ella es muy trabajadora y tiene grandes planes para su futuro, para ella sólo es capaz de realizar los sueños el que, cuando llega la hora, sabe estar preparado y esta preparada para ver crecer su negocio y es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar faldas, pantalones, camisas, relojes, sandalias, carteras etc. María Antonia tiene confianza que su esfuerzo le permitirá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en: María Antonia is 44 years old. She has a small store selling various items such as: clothing, watches, sandals, religious pictures among others. Her business is very popular in the town where she lives as people always find what they need all of very good quality and at a good price. The service is excellent as Maria always receives her customers with a smile on her face. She is very hardworking and has big plans for her future. She believes that you can only make your dreams come true if you are ready and prepared to grow the business when the time comes.This is why she is asking INTEGRAL for a loan which will allow her to buy skirts, trousers, shirts, watches, sandals, handbags etc. María Antonia is confident that her hard work will allow her to provide her family with financial security.

loans.use: to buy skirts, trousers, shirts, watches, sandals and handbags.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda's group is comprised of hard working women. Brenda is 16 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past 3 years, Brenda has been working hard to manage her small retail business which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand her business, Brenda has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase supplies,  like sugar, and will help Brenda to generate greater profits and pay school fees for herself. Brenda hopes that in the future she will be able to become a doctor. 

Brenda is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Brenda’s future prospects by helping her to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase supplies like sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale.

loans.name: Yesenia Elizabeth

texts.es: Yesenia Elizabeth de veintiséis años de edad vive con su compañero de vida cerca a la capital del país en zona urbana. Ella vende productos de uso personal  a cartera de clientes que visita en sus domicilios, vende carteras o bolsos, cremas, cosméticos, shampo entre otros más, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues los vende a muy buen precio y los productos son de muy buena calidad, es una excelente vendedora. La gente la prefiere porque ofrece un servicio excelente y siempre está a su disposición; Yesenia es una mujer llena de energía, muy activa y con mente siempre positiva en el trabajo, su secreto es la constancia y las ganas de salir adelante quiere ver crecer su negocio y es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar variedad de cremas, shampo, acondicionador y cosméticos y así diversificar su oferta para atraer a mas clientes. Yesenia Elizabeth tiene confianza que su trabajo le permitirá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Yeseni Elizabeth is 26 years old and lives with her partner in an urban area close to the capital. She sells personal care products to clients she visits in their  own homes. She sells wallets or handbags, lotions, cosmetics, shampoo, and the like. She has made a lot of customers as she sells at a great price and her products are a very good quality. She is an excellent salesperson. People prefer her because she offers an excellent service and is always available. Yesenia is a woman full of energy, very active who has a positive outlook on work. Her secret is consistency and the desire to get ahead. She wants to see her business grow and for this reason she is asking INTEGRAL for a loan which will allow her to buy various lotions, shampoo, hair conditioner and cosmetics to diversify in a bid to attract more customers. Yesenia Elizabeth is confident that her work will allow her to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy lotions, shampoo, hair conditioner, cosmetics.

loans.name: Iván Darío

texts.es:
Iván es un luchador incansable que nunca se ha rendido ante las dificultades, a sus 53 años de edad se considera un soñador, pues desde que sus hijos nacieron se ha preocupado por brindarles estabilidad y armonía en el hogar y para ello ha tenido que enfrentar grandes retos como el de llegar a la ciudad después de haber vivido por muchos años en el pueblo de donde es oriundo, Cañas Gordas, municipio que hace parte del departamento de Antioquia, allí trabajó en una finca y con la ilusión de progresar y brindarle un mejor futuro a sus hijos  se trasladó a Medellín, donde actualmente tiene una panadería y salsamentaria, en su negocio la variedad y calidad de sus productos, marcan la diferencia. 

Sueña con que este progreso sea continuo, es por este motivo que solicita un préstamo, ya que él no cuenta con el capital necesario para comprar un botellero, en el cual organizar mejor las botellas, dándole al negocio más orden, más espacio, y mejor apariencia.
texts.en:
Iván is a tirelessly determined man who has never surrendered when faced with difficulties. At 53 years of age, he considers himself a dreamer as since the birth of his children he has been concerned with providing them with stability and harmony in the home. To do this he has had to face great challenges such as coming to the city after living for many years in his home town of Cañas Gordas, a municipality that forms part of the department of Antioquia where he used to work on a farm. With the dream of making progress and providing his children with a better future, he moved to Medellín where he currently has a bakery and delicatessen. In his business, range and quality of product make a difference.

He dreams that this progress continues. That  is why he is asking for a loan as he does not have the capital necessary to buy a bottle holder, with which to better organize the bottles, making the business more organized and giving it more space and a better appearance.

loans.use: to buy a bottle holder that he needs for his business.

loans.name: Ana Delmy

texts.es: Ana Delmy de treinta y ocho años de edad vive con su compañero de vida que es empleado y sus hijos. Ella  posee una tienda en su casa donde vende productos de primera necesidad, y un pequeño puesto en el mercado de la localidad que atiende a la hora del almuerzo y en el que vende frutas y verduras; mientras la tienda es atendida por uno de sus hijos que ha regresado de estudiar. En ambos negocios tiene mucha clientela pues es una mujer muy servicial y muy buena vendedora, trata de que todo lo que busquen sus clientes se encuentre disponible, además que lo que comercia es de buena calidad y los vende a precios accesibles, es una mujer dedicada y trabajadora ,para ella triunfa el que se mantiene constante en el camino y cree en sus sueños, uno de sus sueños es ver crecer su negocio por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, productos instantáneos, frutas, verduras entre otros. Ana Delmy tiene la confianza que el gran esfuerzo que realiza día a día en ambas ocupaciones le permitirán llevar a su hogar seguridad económica para una mejor calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: 38-year-old Ana Delmy lives with her life partner, who is an employee, and their children.  She has a store in her home where she sells basic household products and also a small stall in the town market where she serves at lunchtime, selling fruit and vegetables.  While she is on the stall, one of her children who has come home from school will watch the store.  She has a lot of customers for both businesses as she is a very helpful woman and a very good saleswoman.  She tries to ensure that her customers find everything they are looking for and that everything she sells is good quality and sold at affordable prices.  She is a committed and hard-working woman.  She believes that the one who perseveres and believes in their dreams will be successful.  One of Ana Delmy's dreams is to grow her business.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL which will allow her to buy basic grains, candies, ready-to-eat products, fruit, vegetables, etc.  Ana Delmy believes that the hard work she puts into both of her businesses every day will enable her to bring financial security to her household so that her family can enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, candies, ready-to-eat products, fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Nyawa

texts.en:
Nyawa is a married man who lives in his own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years he has operated a meat and goat selling business.  He sells to butcher operators and his neighbouring community members.  His major challenge is seasonality.  Nyawa dreams of expanding his business in the future. 

With a loan of KES 20,000.00, he wants to purchase goats for resale.  He decided to join Yehu to access loans in order to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase goats for resale.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice has been practicing farming for the last ten years in Kimana, Oloitoktok.  She is 38 years old and married to Peter.  They have four children all in school.

She was introduced to KADET by a KADET client.  This will be her first loan.  She intends to use this loan amount to buy pesticides and seedlings. 

In the future, Beatrice hopes to practice large scale farming.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and seedlings.

loans.name: Carlos Hipolito

texts.es:
Carlos Hipolito tiene 54 años de edad, es soltero no tiene hijos vive solo,  en el Canton Chillanes Provincia de Bolivar.

La V.R.C se llama EL PLACER perteneciente al Canton Chillanes parroquia San Jose del Tambo esta ubicada a 60 minutos de la oficina, en esta ventanilla hay 24 socios que se dedican a la agricultura a la siembra de Platano, arroz, yuca, cacao, soya y naranja ademas crian animales de corral.

Carlos Hipolito se dedica a la siembra de arroz, maiz, naranja, soya y platano. Las compras las realiza en San Jose del Tambo y las Vende en el mercado de Chillanes los domingos en la feria.

El credito lo solicita para comprar de insumos agricolas y fertilizantes. El credito le ayudara como apoyo para mejorar la cosecha. No enfrenta desafios importantes. Su sueño es tener buena salud para seguir trabajando.

En los tiempos libres le gusta salir de paseo.
texts.en:
Carlos Hipolito is 54 years old.  He is single, doesn't have any children, and lives alone in Chillanes canton, in Bolivar province.

The 'El Placer' community bank is located in Chillanes canton, in San José del Tambo parish, 60 minutes from our office.  The bank has 24 members who grow bananas, rice, cassava, cacao, soy and oranges.  They also raise farmyard animals.

Carlos Hipolito grows rice, corn, oranges, soy and bananas.  He makes his purchases in San José del Tambo and makes his sales in the Sunday street market in Chillanes.

Carlos Hipolito is requesting this loan to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers.  This loan will help to support him so that he can improve his harvest.  He does not face any serious challenges in his business.  His dream is to enjoy good health so that he can continue working.

In his free time, he enjoys going out for walks.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Bernadette M.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva based in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone. is very pleases to introduce this group of teachers from the eastern city of Koidu/Kono. They are among the first applicants to receive a loan from SMT/Kiva lenders in this city. They have applied for a loan of 9,500,000 SLL in order to solve their immediate financial needs. At the end of each month, they will repay the loan, using their monthly salaries. Their school’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and repays SMT/Kiva on their behalf. 

Bernadette is the leader of this group of teachers. Born in Kono, Bernadette, who is 51 years old, has been in the teaching profession for 30 years. She is single with five children, all of whom attend school. She has applied for this loan in order to purchase furniture and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase furniture and pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Las Divinas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS DIVINAS” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Silvia. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: comercio, producción, servicio y tienda de barrio.

La señora Candelaria,  indica que es la primera vez que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por medio un bolante. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio tienda de barrio que viene trabajando hace dos años aprendiendo el mismo de su madre.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, etc.), que comprara de las ferias  y lo venderá en su tienda de 6:00 a 22:00. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación para su negocio y la atención en salud.
texts.en:
The “Las Divinas" community bank is about to start its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Santiago II regional office.  The bank has eight members and is run by a board of directors which is led by Sílvia.  The businesses that the members of the community bank are engaged in are varied and include: commerce, production, services and running a neighborhood store.

Candelaria tells us that this is the first time she has worked with Pro Mujer.  She joined when she saw a flyer.  Her business is a neighborhood store and she has been working there for two years.  She learned the business from her mother.

Candelaria will use the loan that she is requesting to increase her capital (buying rice, sugar, oil, etc).  She will buy these products in the street markets and sell them in her store from 6.00am to 10.00pm.  This work enables her to make money with which to support her family.  She is married and has one child.

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, Candelaria replied that she likes the business training and the health service.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Vilma Melida

texts.es: Vilma Melida D. 49 años D. edad, habita en casa propia junto con su grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su esposo y sus dos hijos D. 16 y 8 años los cuales gracias al trabajo D. Vilma junto con su esposo se encuentran estudiando. Vilma es una mujer luchadora, trabajadora y sobre todo emprendedora. Para Vilma no hay obstáculo que le impida realizar sus tareas diarias. Ella se dedica a la venta D. prendas D. vestir como: faldas, pantalones, blusas, vestidos y D. D. mas prendas atractivas para los clientes.  Esta actividad la realiza D. manera ambulante en las diferentes zonas del lugar donD. ella habita. Además ha adecuado su casa para realizar las ventas D. sus artículos cuando ella se encuentra en casa. Vilma es una mujer ejemplar que con su arduo trabajo y dedicación se ha ganado la confianza D. todos  clientes los cuales cada día la prefieren más. Vilma ha tomado la decisión D. solicitar este crédito a  INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio en la compra D. diferentes prendas D. vestir como: pantalones, faldas, camisas, blusas, vestidos y D. mas prendas al por mayor que permitan a traer a mas clientes y que genere mayores ganancias. Todo esto con el objetivo D. mejorar sus niveles D. venta y D. ingresos que le permitan aspirar a una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
49-year-old Vilma Melida lives in her own home together with her family group which consists of her husband and her two children aged 16 and 8.  Thanks to the work of Vilma and her husband, the chiildren are in school.

Vilma is a tenacious, hard-working and, above all, entrepreneurial woman.  There is no obstacle that will stop Vilma carrying out her daily tasks.  Her business is selling clothes such as skirts, pants, blouses, dresses and other garments that appeal to her customers.  She makes her sales as an itinerant vendor in the different areas around her home.  She has also set up her house so that she can sell her goods while she is at home.  Vilma is an exemplary woman who, through her hard work and commitment, has gained the trust of all her customers who are increasingly loyal to her business.

Vilma has taken the decision to request this loan from INTEGRAL to invest in her business, buying different clothes such as pants, skirts, shirts, blouses, dresses and other items wholesale.  This will allow her to attract more customers and make more profits.  She does all this with the aim of improving her sales levels and her income.  This will enable her to aspire to a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothes such as pants, skirts, shirts, blouses, dresses, etc.

loans.name: Carlos Antonio

texts.es: Carlos Antonio de 63 años de edad, habita en casa propia en una humilde zona del país, junto con su compañera de vida de 60 años y una amiga de 50 años. Durante mucho tiempo ha trabajado duramente para sacar adelante a su querida familia. Carlos  posee un molino de nixtamal el cual ha instalado en su hogar de residencia. Muchas personas lo buscan para moler el maíz que convertirán en una masa que posteriormente se convierte en ricas tortillas, base fundamental de la dieta alimenticia en este país. Carlos se ha ganado la confianza de muchas personas en la zona donde habita ya que es un hombre carismático, dedicado y honesto. Carlos ha trabajado toda su vida en este negocio y es el que le ha generado el pan de cada día. Últimamente ha notado que el molino necesita mantenimiento y algunos repuestos ya que por el uso que le dá estos se gastan con facilidad. Es por esta razón que solicita a INTEGRAL este crédito para invertir en su negocio y comprar repuestos para el buen funcionamiento del molino que es su principal herramienta de trabajo. Confía en Dios y en su trabajo que de esta forma logrará mejorar el servicio a sus clientes permitiéndole mantener su negocio activo por más tiempo y seguir recibiendo los frutos que por mucho tiempo le ha dado. De esta forma espera continuar llevando el sustento necesario a su hogar.
texts.en:
63-year-old Carlos Antonio lives in his own home in a less well-off area of the country.  He lives with his life partner who is 60 years old and a [female] friend who is 50 years old.  For a long time, he has worked hard to get his beloved family ahead in life.

Carlos own a mill for grinding 'nixtamal' (corn).  The mill is set up in his home.  Many people come to him to grind corn into cornmeal that they later use to make delicious tortillas, a basic foodstuff in this country's diet.  Carlos has gained the trust of many people in his area as he is a charismatic, committed and honest man.  He has worked his whole life in this business and it is how he has earned his daily bread.  Lately, Carlos has noticed that his mill needs servicing and some spare parts because, as a result of the use that it gets, these parts wear out easily.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to invest in his business and buy spare parts so that his mill works properly as it is his main work tool.  He trusts in God and his work and believes that he will manage to improve his customer service which will enable him to keep his business going longer and continue receiving the rewards that he has been receiving for a long time.  In this way, he hopes to continue providing his household with the support they need.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his mill

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married and has four children, one of whom attends school while the other three are working. They live in their own house that has neither  electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, Fatuma been selling paraffin from home to her neighbors. She also sells chickens to boost her income. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation. Her major dream is to establish a filling station and also own several chickens.

Fatuma is requesting a loan for 40,000 KES, which she will use to purchase jerrycans of paraffin and establish a chicken house. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase  jerrycans of paraffin and establish a chicken house.

loans.name: Mohamed C.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are a group of teachers from the eastern city of Koidu/Kono. They have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone to apply for a loan of 7,800,000 SLL. With the help of this loan, they will be able to solve their immediate financial needs and then gradually repay the loan, using their monthly salaries. These teachers are among the lucky few to be among the first set of applicants to receive a loan from SMT/Kiva in Koidu city. 

Their leader is Mohamed. Born in Kono, the 55-year-old is married and has five children – one in primary school and four in secondary school. Mohamed has been a professional teacher for 36 years now. He has applied for this loan in order to complete the construction of a house he is building for his family. He will use the loan to buy house building materials like iron corrugate zincs, pay workers, etc.

loans.use: to buy house building materials and to pay workers

loans.name: Mariaj's Group

texts.es:
Mariaj's Group está conformado por 7 personas: 4 mujeres y 3 hombres grupo del cual María es la presidenta.

María tiene 47 años vive en Latacunga con su esposo y sus 4 hijos los cuales tienen 25, 22, 19 y 15 años de edad. María se describe como una persona responsable en el hogar y muy tranquila.

Trabaja con su familia en la crianza de animales (ganado) para su venta. Es  la primera vez que solicita créditos a Fodemi el mismo que será utilizado para la compra de ganado para su reproducción y crianza lo cual aumentará sus ventas e ingresos y mejorará la calidad de vida de su familia.

Su sueño es dar el estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mariaj's Group has seven members: four women and three men.  María is the president of this group.

María is 47 years old and lives in Latacunga with her husband and four children who are 25, 22, 19 and 15.  She describes herself as a person who is responsible with her household duties and very calm.

María works together with her family raising animals (livestock) to sell.  This is the first time that she has requested a loan from Fodemi and she will use the money to buy livestock to breed and raise.  This will increase her sales and income and improve her family's quality of life.

María's dream is to provide her children with an education.

loans.use: to buy livestock to breed and raise

loans.name: Celso

texts.es: El señor Celso, es rentista jubilado de una institución pública. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de material de construcción (cemento, arena, ladrillo) ya que realizara la refacción de su vivienda. Vive en casa de propia, ubicada en la zona de Los Andes en la ciudad de El Alto; es casado y tiene 1 hijo . Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito y desea que se canalize a través de los financiadotes de Kiva.
texts.en:
Celso is a retired pensioner from a public institution.  He needs the loan to buy construction material (cement, sand, bricks) to fix up his house.

He lives in his own house in the Los Andes zone in the city of El Alto.  He is married and has one child.

This is the first time that he has requested a loan, and he wishes for his loan to be channeled through Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy construction material in order to fix up his house.

loans.name: Bety Eugenia

texts.es: Bety Eugenia de 40 años de edad, habita en casa propia junto con su compañero de vida y su hija la cual ya es mayor de edad. Ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir para todos los gustos, tamaños y preferencia, llo hace de forma ambulante y también en su misma casa. Ya tiene varios años de dedicarce al negocio razón por la cual ya cuanta con mucha clientela establecida. Además es una mujer carismática, emprendedora y dedicada a su trabajo. Los clientes la prefieren ya que cuando de ropa se trata ella tiene lo mejor tanto en precios como en variedad.  Su sueño es ver su negocio florecer y poder cubrir una mayor demanda que le permita aumentar su nivel de ventas y por consecuencia su nivel de ingresos. Esto la ha motivado a solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para poder invertir en su negocio en la compra de variedad de prendas de vestir (faldas, pantalones, camisas, vestidos, etc.). Que le permitan lograr el sueño de su vida con el objetivo de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
40-year-old Bety Eugenia lives in her own home together with her life partner and her grown-up daughter.  Her business is selling clothes for all tastes, sizes and preferences.  She makes her sales as an itinerant vendor and also sells from home.  She has been in this business for several years and so already has a lot of existing customers.  In addition, Bety Eugenia is a charismatic, entrepreneurial woman who is committed to her work.  Her customers are loyal to her business because, when it comes to clothes, she has the best prices and the best variety.

Bety Eugenia's dream is to see her business thrive and to be able to deal with greater demand, which would allow her to increase her sales levels and, thereby, her income.  This has motivated her to request a loan from INTEGRAL, so that she can invest in her business by purchasing a variety of garments (skirts, pants, shirts, dresses, etc).  This will enable her to achieve her dream in life, improving her own quality of life as well as that of her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothes such as skirts, pants, shirts, dresses, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice and noodles wholesale to sell by the pound in her store.

loans.name: María Lilian

texts.es: María Lilian D. 38 años D. edad habita en casa propia, muy cerca a la capital del país y en zona urbana, junto con su grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su esposo y sus cuatro hijas las cuales se encuentran estudiando. María posee un puesto en el mercado del lugar donD. ella habita en el cual venD. variedad D. cereales como: maíz, frijoles y arroz. Este lugar es muy concurrido y muy estratégico ya que se encuentra en el centro D. la ciudad donD. María habita. Ya tiene mucho tiempo D. dedicarse al negocio y gracias a Dios y a su jovialidad y arduo trabajo ha sabido mantenerlo en marcha. María es el tipo D. mujer que le gusta colaborar con la economía del hogar esta es la razón por la cual desD. muy tempranas horas D. la mañana se levanta y acuD. a su negocio para ganarse el pan D. cada día y poder llevarlo a la casa. Para ella lo más importante es su familia y es esta la que la impulsa a trabajar arduamente con la esperanza D. mejorar su calidad D. vida. Todo esto la ha hecho tomar la decisión D. solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio en la compra D. cereales (maíz, arroz, frijoles) al por mayor con fin D. contar con las cantidades necesarias cuando los clientes la soliciten y obtenerlos a precios mas bajos. Confía en Dios que D. esta manera logrará mejorar su calidad D. vida y la D. su familia.
texts.en:
38-year-old María Lilian lives in her own home, in an urban area very close to the country's capital city.  She lives with her family group which consists of her husband and her four daughters who are all in school.  María owns a stall in her local market where she sells a variety of cereals such as corn, beans and rice.  The place is very busy and very strategically located as it is in the center of the city where María lives.  She has been in this business for a long time and thanks to God, her cheerfulness and her hard work, she has known how to keep the business going.

María is the kind of woman who enjoys contributing towards her household finances and so she gets up very early every morning and goes to her business in order to earn her daily bread which she will then take home.  The most important thing in María's life is her family and this is what drives her to work hard, with the hope that she will improve their quality of life.  This has led her to take the decision to request a loan from INTEGRAL to invest in her business by purchasing cereals (corn, rice and beans) wholesale.  Her aim is to have available the quantity she needs for her customers and to obtain it at lower prices.  She trusts in God that, in this way, she will manage to improve her own life as well as that of her family.

loans.use: to buy cereals (corn, rice and beans)

loans.name: Virgen De Fátima Group

texts.es:
El Comité Virgen de Fátima se conformó con la iniciativa de una de las miembros, está integrado por 10 mujeres, actualmente están en el primer ciclo. Son todas vecinas y amigas de la ciudad de Curuguaty, por tal motivo les gusto el programa de Comité de Mujeres Rurales de la Fundación Paraguaya, como que todas tienen una actividad económica fija decidieron comprometerse entre sí trabajando todas juntas por un bien común. Ellas están aprendiendo a trabajar en equipo, también a ahorrar cosa que nunca antes lo habían hecho.
Una de ellas es la señora Mirian, ella se dedica a la venta de prendas usadas, como ser remeras, camisas pantalones y demás. Comenta que tiene mucha clientela que frecuentemente compra de ella, ya que ella es una persona muy buena a la hora de tratar con los clientes. Una de sus metas es poder tener una tienda propia donde pueda ofrecer sus prendas. Comenta que todo lo que realiza es por darle a su familia todo lo que necesitan.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas como ser camisas, pantalones, remeras y demás para la posterior venta. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da, pues de obtener el crédito le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The Virgen de Fátima committee was formed thanks to the initiative of one of its members.  It is made up of 10 women that are currently in their first loan cycle. They are all neighbors and friends from the city of Curuguaty. Because of this, they like the Comité de Mujeres Rurales (Rural Women Committee) program of the Fundación Paraguaya. Since they all have a fixed economic activity, they decided to commit to each other, working together for a common good. They are learning to work together as a team and also to save, which is something that they had never done before. 
One of the members is Mirian. She sells used clothing such as T-shirts, shirts, pants etc. She says that she has many customers that frequently buy from her, since she is very good at dealing with customers. One of her goals is to have her own store from which to sell the clothing. She says that everything she does is in order to provide her family with all that they need.
She is requesting the loan to buy clothing such as shirts, pants, T-shirts etc. to later sell. She is grateful to the Foundation for the opportunity that it gives her; obtaining the loan will be very helpful to her.

loans.use: to buy second-hand shirts, T-shirts and pants to resell.

loans.name: Rubenia

texts.es: Rubenia D. 57 años D. edad, habita en casa propia junto con su nieto Melvin el cual ya es mayor D. edad. Rubenia se dedica a la venta D. productos D. belleza por catalogo en su propia casa que se encuentra en una zona D. mucho comercio alrededor y ella a aprovechado eso. Ya tiene mucho tiempo D. dedicarse al negocio y muchas personas la prefieren por ser una mujer honesta, trabajadora y sobre todo carismática. Ella tiene muchas ideas D. negocio que poco a poco va poniendo en marcha. Gracias a su creatividad en los negocios ha sabido adecuar su hogar D. residencia para colocar sus productos D. belleza y ofrecerlos a los clientes. Es una mujer digna D. confianza D. la cual los vecinos dan muy buenas referencia. Últimamente Rubenia ha estado pensando en la posibilidad D. surtir su negocio con variedad D. productos D. belleza con el fin D. atraer a más clientes y cubrir una mayor demanda. Esto la hizo tomar la decisión D. solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para comprar variedad D. productos D. belleza por catalogo tales como: cremas, lociones, jabones, champo, desodorantes y D. más artículos que sean atractivos para los clientes. D. esta manera espera lograr su sueño D. poder dar a su familia una mejora oportunidad D. vida.
texts.en:
57-year-old Rubenia lives in her own home together with her grown-up grandson Melvin.  Her business is selling beauty products through a catalog.  She sells her products in her own home which is located in an area with a lot of commercial activity round about.  She has taken advantage of this.  Rubenia has been in her business for a long time and many people prefer to buy from her as she is an honest, hard-working and, above all, charismatic woman.  She has many business ideas that she is gradually putting into action.  Thanks to her creativity in her business, she has known how to set up her home so that she can display her beauty products and sell them to her customers.  She is a trustworthy woman whose neighbors give her very good references. 

Lately, Rubenia has been planning to stock her business with a range of beauty products so that she can attract more customers and deal with more demand.  This led her to take the decision to request a loan from INTEGRAL, to buy a range of beauty products from a catalog such as creams, lotions, soap, shampoo, deodorants and other products that will appeal to her customers.  In this way, she hopes to achieve her dream of providing her family with a better opportunity in life.

loans.use: to buy a range of beauty products from a catalog (creams, lotions, soap, shampoo, deodorants, etc.)

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy house-building materials like bags of cements, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spare parts, chargers and earphones for cell phones.

loans.name: Euridice Conforte's Group

texts.fr: Chef de fil d'un groupe de 5 personnes, Conforte est mariée et a à charge 4 enfants. Ses enfants sont tous scolarisés et évoluent très bien à l'école. Cette cliente a pour activité principale la vente des sacs de charbon qui lui sont livrés à domicile par les grossistes ayant reçu l'agrément de commercialiser les produits forestiers. Sa clientèle est  constituée des ménages résidant dans la même localité que lui ainsi que les zones environnantes. Conforte est à son 1er crédit à FINADEV et sollicite le renouvellement afin  de renforcer son stock de provision et de diversifier ses produits pour une meilleure satisfaction des attentes de sa clientèle. Le bénéfice qu'engendrera le prêt lui permettra d'améliorer la qualité des conditions de vie de sa famille en participant d'avantage aux  charges de sa famille. Ces coéquipières exercent elles aussi leurs activités, soit à domicile, soit dans des boutiques installées dans les localités proches de leurs domiciles.
texts.en: The leader of a group of 5 women, Conforte is married and responsible for four children, all of whom are currently being educated in school. She sells bags of charcoal that are delivered to her home in bulk quantities by wholesalers who have approval to sell forest products. Her client base is composed of a multitude of neighboring residents and those living in the surrounding areas. Conforte is currently repaying her first loan from FINADEV and is asking for a loan renewal in order to purchase greater quantities and diversify the types of products she has in order to satisfy her clients. Profits she receives will enable her to improve the living conditions of her family. Her colleagues are also small business owners that work from their homes or small boutiques located near their homes.

loans.use: purchase five bags of charcoal

loans.name: Nueva Semilla Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVA SEMILLA” iniciará su tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Adela. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: Tienda de barrio, trenzado de mantas, venta de fruta, taller de carpintería, venta de chuño, repostería, venta de verdura, taller de costura.

La señora Adela, indica que dos años que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una compañera. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de fruta que viene trabajando hace treinta años atrás aprendiendo el mismo de su mamá.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de fruta) que adquirirá del Tejar y que posteriormente lo comercializa en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de capacitación.
texts.en:
The 'Nueva Semilla' community bank are about to start their third loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Los Andes regional office.  The group has eight members and is run by a board of directors which is led by Adela.  The businesses that the members of the community bank are engaged in are varied and include: a neighborhood store, weaving blankets, selling fruit, a carpentry workshop, selling 'chuño' (freeze-dried potato), making pastries and desserts, selling vegetables and a sewing workshop.

Adela tells us that she has been working with Pro Mujer for two years.  She joined the institution through an invitation from a friend.  She has a business selling fruit which she has been running for thirty years, having learned the business from her mom.

Adela will use the loan that she is taking out to increase her capital (buying fruit).  She will buy her fruit in El Tejar and then sell it from her stall.  This work enables her to make income with which to support her family.  She is married and has one child.

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, Adela replied that she likes the training.

loans.use: to buy fruit

loans.name: Blanca Yesenia
