texts.es: Blanca Yesenia D. 31 años D. edad, habita en casa propia en zona urbana al oriente del país, junto con su grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su esposo José Antonio D. 29 años D. edad y sus dos queridas hijas. Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta D. ricos, variados y ecconómicos platillos D. comida. Su negocio está ubicado en el sector cocinas del mercado central D. la ciudad donD. ella habita. Este lugar es muy transitado principalmente el comedor D. Blanca ya que ella siempre cuenta con los mejores platillos y además siempre atienD. a sus clientes con una sonrisa lo que hace que los clientes regresen a consumir sus ricos platillos. Su sueño es ver su negocio florecer y convertirse en la líder en comidas D. la zona. Pero para esto necesita invertir cierta cantidad D. dinero en la compra mayor cantidad D. materia  prima D. manera que pueda tener diferentes platillos y la cantidad suficiente para atraer a más clientes que le permitan cumplir su sueño.  Esto justifica la decisión D. solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL ya que necesita invertir en la compra D. variedad D. materia prima como: carnes, pollos, verduras, frijoles, arroz, aceite, etc. con el objetivo D. contar con los ingredientes necesarios para elaborar ricos y variados platillos que permitan  atraer a más clientes. Confía en Dios que logrará su objetivo y mejorará su calidad D. vida y la D. su familia.
texts.en:
31-year-old Blanca Yesenia lives in her own home, in an urban area, in the east of the country.  She lives with her family group which consists of her husband, 29-year-old José Antonio, and her two beloved daughters.

Blanca's business is making and selling delicious, varied and reasonably-priced meals.  Her business is located in the food section of the central market in the city where she lives.  The place is very busy, especially Blanca's diner, as she always has the best dishes on offer and always serves her customers with a smile.  This means that her customers come back to eat her delicious food.

Blanca's dream is to see her business thrive and become the number one food seller in her area.  However, in order to achieve this, she needs to invest a certain quantity of money in buying a larger quantity of supplies so that she can offer different dishes.  She needs a large enough quantity so that she can attract more customers which will allow her to achieve her dream.  This justifies her decision to request this loan from INTEGRAL.  She needs to invest in buying a range of supplies such as meat, chicken, vegetables, beans, rice, oil, etc.  Her goal is to have the ingredients she needs to make her delicious and varied dishes so that she can attract more customers.  She trusts in God that she will achieve her goal and improve her own quality of life as well as that of her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of supplies such as meat, chicken, vegetables, beans, rice, oil, etc.

loans.name: Ines

texts.es: La señora Inés, se dedica a la venta de productos de Herbalife y también a la venta de ropa. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de mayor cantidad de ropa para abrir una tienda en la zona 16 de julio de la ciudad de El Alto, que es una zona de alto tráfico de clientes. Inés trabaja muy fuerte para conseguir que estas dos actividades sean la fuente de ingresos que tiene para cubrir sus gastos. Vive en la casa de sus padres la misma queda  ubicada en la zona Villa San Antonio de la ciudad de La Paz; es soltera y no tiene hijos. Inés tiene unas ganas de superación admirables.
texts.en: Inés sell Herbalife products and also clothes.  She needs the loan to buy large amounts of clothing to open a store in the city of El Alto’s 16 de Julio area which is an area with high customer traffic.  Inés works very hard so that both these activities will be sources of income to cover her expenses.  She lives in her parents’ house which is located in the city of La Paz’s Villa San Antonio zone.  She’s single and has no children.  Inés has an admirable drive to get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy clothing in quantity in order to open a store in the business district of the city of El Alto.

loans.name: Mirna Patricia

texts.es: Mirna Patricia D. 34 años D. edad, habita en casa propia dentro D. una ciudad urbana cercana a la capital del país, junto con su grupo familiar el cual lo conforma su esposo y sus dos hijas. Mirna se dedica a la venta D. productos D. primera necesidad tales como: medicinas, frijoles, arroz, aceite, golosinas, detergente y D. mas artículos  que los clientes soliciten. Su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su hogar D. residencia el cual se encuentra sobre la calle principal del lugar donD. ella habita. Esto es una ventaja para ella ya que muchos clientes la prefieren por encontrarse en un lugar accesible y sobre todo porque ella siempre los atienD. con una sonrisa y con mucha amabilidad. Ya tiene 7 años D. dedicarse al negocio y durante todo este tiempo le ha dado muy buenos frutos. Para ella lo más importante es su familia y trabaja duramente para poder darles lo que necesitan. Esto la ha motivado a solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su tienda en la  compra D. productos por mayor como: detergentes, aceite, arroz, frijoles, café, medicinas, golosinas, pan dulce,tc. para surtir su negocio y poder atraer a más clientes que demanden sus productos con el fin D. mejorar sus ingresos y la calidad D. vida D. su familia
texts.en:
34-year-old Mirna Patricia lives in her own home, in an urban town, near the country's capital city.  She lives with her family group which consists of her husband and her two daughters.

Mirna sells basic household products such as medicines, beans, rice, oil, candies, detergents and other items that her customers request.  Her business is in her home which is located on the main road.  This is an advantage for her.  Many customers prefer to buy from her because she is in an easily-accessible place but, above all, because she serves them with a smile and a lot of kindness.  She has been in this business for seven years and, over the years, the business has provided her with very good rewards.  The most important thing in Mirna's life is her family and she works hard so that she can give them what they need.  This has motivated her to request a loan from INTEGRAL, to invest in her store by purchasing products wholesale such as detergents, oil, rice, beans, coffee, medicines, candies, sweet bread, etc.  This will enable her to stock her business and attract more customers.  Her aim is to improve her income and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy products wholesale such as detergents, oil, rice, beans, coffee, medicines, candies, sweet bread, etc.

loans.name: Henry

texts.es: El señor Henry,  trabaja como chofer  con su taxi para una compañía de Radio Taxis. El crédito lo requiere para el mantenimiento de su movilidad, pues necesita cambio de líquidos y fluidos y un chequeo general de frenos y motor. Vive en casa propia  la misma queda ubicada en la zona Llojeta en la ciudad de La Paz, es casado y tiene dos  hijos.
texts.en: Henry works as a taxi driver for a radio dispatched taxi firm.  He needs the loan to service his vehicle because it needs liquids and fluids replacement and a general brake and motor check-up.  He lives in his own house located in the city of La Paz’s Llojeta zone.  He’s married and has two children.

loans.use: to service his radio dispatched taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pays his children's school fees and buy cements, etc. for the construction of his house

loans.name: Cheikh

texts.fr: Monsieur Cheikh est âgé de 32 ans. Il habite au Sénégal. Il est marié et père d’un enfant. Il évolue dan le secteur du transport depuis plus de 2ans et conduit un véhicule taxi brousse.Parallèlement  il exerce une activité de commerce de vente de pièces de véhicule en provenance de Dubaï. Il a opté pour ces activités par amour mais  aussi dans le souci de gagner sa vie et lutter contre l’oisiveté.  Les moments les plus favorables pour son activité  coïncident  avec l’année scolaire. Il est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis 4 ans. Il sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de pièces  de véhicules a revendre. Il souhaite compléter  son fond de roulement et mieux développer son activité de commerce. Son  principal objectif est d’acquérir une autonomie financière.
texts.en:
Monsieur Cheikh is 32 years old. He lives in Sénégal. He is married and the father of one child. He has been working in the transport sector for more than two years and drives a taxi. At the same time, he sells vehicle spare parts coming from Dubai. He chose these businesses because he enjoys them but also in order to earn his living and struggle against idleness. 

The most favorable moments for his line of work coincide with the school year. He has been a member of a branch of U-IMCEC for four years. He is requesting a loan of 200,000 francs to use to buy vehicle spare parts for resale. He would like to add to his working capital and further develop his business. His primary objective is to attain financial autonomy.

loans.use: To buy vehicle spare parts for resale.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.es: El señor Benjamín, es pintor y restaura cuadros dañados. El crédito lo requiere para la comprar materiales como ser: pinturas, lienzos, pinceles y otros insumos requeridos en su profesión. Vive en casa propia  ubicada en la zona  Tacagua en la ciudad de La Paz;  es casado  y  tiene  2  hijos.  Benjamín ha acudido a IMPRO cuatro veces para solicitar crédito y esta es la tercera vez que canalizamos su crédito a través de Kiva.
texts.en: Benjamín is a painter and restores damaged paintings.  He needs the loan to buy materials like: paint, canvas, brushes and other supplies needed in his profession.  He lives in his own house located in the city of La Paz’s Tacagua zone.  He’s married and has two children.  Benjamín has called on IMPRO four times to request a loan and this is the third time we’ve channeled his loan through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy paint, canvas and brushes to continue restoring paintings.

loans.name: Milton

texts.es: Milton, de 48 años, es un señor muy amable y trabajador, esta separado de su pareja, pero como ambos compraron una casa, viven juntos en ella y en compañía de sus hijos. EL trabajo de Milton consiste en la siembra y cosecha de cítricos durante, además de verduras, siendo éste último ejerciéndol por más de 25 años, mientras que los cítricos desde hace 10 años. El trabajo que realiza en sus tierras es buena, por ello es que tiene productos grandes y buenos y tiene mucha demanda por parte de sus compradores en el mercado mayorista de su ciudad. Le gusta la actividad que realiza, ama estar en el campo, estar en contacto con la naturaleza, pues él creció ahí y se a convertido en su fuente de desarrollo y económica. Sus clientes saben la calidad del producto que posee y le pagan el precio que él exige, pero ahora tiene un gran proyecto, le encantaría tecnificar sus plantaciones de cítricos, poner un sistema automático de riego y hacer un pozo tubular para que tenga así un mejor resultado. Este será el noveno crédito con MFP, pues considera que la institución es de gran ayuda para su inversión. Con el monto solicitado, lo utilizará para preparar su terreno con la compra de abono, fertilizante y contratar joranleros.
texts.en: Forty-eight-year-old Milton is a very kind and hardworking man.  He is separated from his partner, but as they bought a house together, they both live in it with their children.  Milton's work consists of planting and harvesting citrus fruits, as well as vegetables.  He has been growing the latter for more than 25 years, while he has been growing citrus fruits for 10 years.  He does good work on his land, which is why he produces large, good produce that is in high demand from his buyers in the city's wholesale market.  He likes his business and loves being in contact with nature in the fields as he grew up there and it has become his source of development and income.  His customers know the quality of his produce and they pay him what he asks, but at the moment he has a big project; he would love to introduce modern technology to his citrus planting by putting in an automatic irrigation system and digging a tubular well to produce better results.  This will be his ninth loan with MFP, as he considers the institution to be of great help with his investments.  He will use the requested total to prepare his land by buying fertilizers and to hire day laborers.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizer and to hire day laborers

loans.name: Las Curuguateñas Group

texts.es:
10 mujeres de la ciudad de Curuguaty se unieron con el propósito de generar mayores ingresos para ellas y para sus familias. Desean poder desarrollarse no solo en el ámbito económico, sino también a nivel personal. Ellas son mujeres muy sacrificadas y trabajadoras que siempre luchan por darle a sus familias lo mejor. Actualmente se encuentran en el segundo ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la Fundación.
Una de las miembros es la señora Mariela, ella tiene una pequeña despensa desde hace ya un buen tiempo, comenta que tiene muchos clientes que diariamente van hasta su negocio y compran de ella. Su pequeño local le trae buenas ganancias por lo que le gustaría poder seguir invirtiendo en el. Comenta que diariamente se esfuerza para poder darle a su familia todo lo mejor para que tengan una vida digna y decorosa.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de comestibles, bebidas, lácteos y otros productos para abastecer su negocio y por medio de esto cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ten women from the city of  Curuguaty came together for the purpose of generating more income for themselves and their families.They want to grow not only economically but also at the personal level. They are hardworking and self-sacrificing women who always fight to give their families the best they can. They currently find themselves in the second cycle of the women entrepreneurs program offered by the Fundacion.

One of the members is Señora Mariela. She has had a small store for a long time. She says that she has a lot customers who come to her stall on a daily basis to buy from her. Her small locale bring her good profits which is why she wouild like to continue investing in it. She says that she strives hard every day to give her family the best she can so that they have a dignified and decent life. 

She is asking for the loan to buy groceries, beverages, dairy and other products to stock her business and so satisfy her customers.

loans.use: to buy groceries, beverages, dairy and other such products.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Madame Aminata habite au Sénégal. Elle est âgée  de 46 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle s’active dans le commerce de produits cosmétiques, tissus, vaisselles et divers autres articles. L’expérience d e son mari qui était commerçant  l’a influencé a choisir cette activité. Elle l’aidait régulièrement  à vendre et  finalement elle  a  épousé la passion du métier. Les moments le plus favorables sont les périodes de fête. Elle est sociétaire de l’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis un an et a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit antérieur. Elle sollicite un prêt de 500 000 frs prévu pour l’achat d’articles qu’elle commercialise a revendre. Elle veut  renforcer  son fond de roulement, développer son activité de commerce, accroitre ses bénéfices pour couvrir toutes les dépenses liées a la gestion de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Aminata lives in Senegal. She is 46 years old, married, and the mother of six children. She is active in the commerce of cosmetics, cloth, pots and pans, and various other goods. Her husband, who is a merchant, has experience that influenced her to choose this business. She used to help him regularly in making sales; in the end, she espoused her passion for this trade. The most favorable moments are during holidays.

Ms. Aminata has been an associate of a U-IMCEC branch for a year and has already benefited from a previous loan. She is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs for buying goods that she will market and resell. She wants to bolster her working capital, to develop her commerce, and to grow her profits in order to cover all the expenses related to running a family.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and other goods to resell

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es: El señor Guillermo, está empleado como auxiliar de oficina en una Institución religiosa de la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito lo requiere para la cubrir gastos de exámenes médicos personales. Vive en alquiler en una casa ubicada en la zona  central en la ciudad de La Paz;  es casado  y  tiene  un hijo. Es  la primera vez que Guillermo tiene un crédito en IMPRO y por el carácter social de ayuda se lo canaliza a través de Kiva y sus financiadores.
texts.en: Guillermo is employed as an office assistant in a religious institution in the city of La Paz.  He needs the loan to cover some personal medical expenses.  He lives in a rented house located in the central zone of the city of La Paz.  He’s married and has a son.  This is the first time that Guillermo has an IMPRO loan and because of its social characteristics it’s being channeled through Kiva and its lenders.

loans.use: to pay for some needed medical tests.

loans.name: Eulalia's Group

texts.es:
Eulalia's Group está conformado por 4 mujeres, grupo del cual María es la presidenta.

María tiene 54 años, es casada y tiene 7 hijas, vive con su familia en Salcedo que está muy cerca de Latacunga en el centro de Ecuador. María se describe como una persona fuerte de caracter, responsable.

Trabaja con su esposo e hijas en su panadería. Es la primera vez que le solicita créditos a Fodemi, el mismo que será utilizado para la compra de harina, manteca, huevos para la elaboración de pan lo cual incrementará sus ventas e ingresos que mejorarán su calidad de vida.

Su sueño es comprar un vehículo para poder distribuir pan a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Eulalia's Group, of which Maria is the president, consists of 4 women.

María is 54 years old, married and has 7 children. She lives with her family in Salcedo which is very near Latacunga in the centre of Ecuador. María  describes herself as being responsible and a person of strong character.

She works with her husband and daughters in their bakery. This is the first time she applies to Fodemi for a loan which will be used for the of purchase flour, butter, eggs for making bread. This will increase their sales and revenue which will improve their quality of life.

Her dream is to buy a vehicle to be able to distribute bread to their clients.

loans.use: to buy flour, butter and eggs for making bread.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to build a home for his family.

loans.name: Ricardo Presentado

texts.es:
El señor Ricardo es de la ciudad de Itá, tiene 33 años de edad, está casado con la señora Daniela, que trabaja como docente, comentan que aún no tienen la dicha de tener hijos.
El señor Ricardo es Técnico en Electrónica, realiza servicios técnicos, proyectos ejecutivos, mantenimiento de computadoras y PC, y además venta de accesorios para computadoras en general. Hace mas de 8 años que se decica a esta profección y hace 2 años aproximadamente que trabaja de manera independiente. Él se define como una persona muy trabajadora. Comenta que uno de sus proyectos a futuro es poder tener una tienda amplia donde pueda vender todo tipo de dispositivos para las computadoras. Desea darle a su esposa un estilo de vida diferente, donde vivan con las comodidades mínimas y sin privaciones.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de accesorios de computadoras, para la posterior venta, sabe que de obtener el crédito este le será de gran ayuda en sus emprendimientos.
texts.en:
Señor Ricardo is from the city of Ita. He is 33 years old and is married to Señora Daniela who works as a teacher. He says that they have not as yet had the joy of having children.

Señor Ricardo is an electronics technician. He performs technical services, project management, computer and PC maintenance and in addition sells accessories for computers in general. He has been in this profession for more than 8 years and for the last 2 years has been self-employed. He describes himself as a very hardworking person. He says that one of his future projects is to have a large shop where he can sell all kinds of devices for computers. He wants to give his wife a different lifestyle, to live with the minimum of facilities and without deprivation. 

He is asking for the loan to buy computer accessories for subsequent sale. He knows that obtaining this loan will be a great help to him in his  endeavors.

.

loans.use: to buy computer accessories for subsequent sale.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: El apreciable Sr. Manuel es una persona seria y  responsable , se dedica al servicio de la construcción como colocación de  pisos, cielos rústicos, bardas, casas en sus totalidad, lleva ya  tres  años dedicándose  a la  albañilería , anteriormente laboraba en una constructora, pero decidió independizarse ya  que  piensa  que  de  esta  manera mejora su bienestar económico de  el  y  de  su  familia  la  cual  representa  lo mas importante  en la  vida, es  por  ello  que  acudió  con  nosotros  para   realizar  la  compra  de materia  prima  para  seguir   trabajando, ve   en su  proyecto  la  posibilidad  de  incrementar   sus  ingresos   permitiendo  brindar  a  su   familia una  mayor  estabilidad  económica.
texts.en: The esteemed Senor Manuel is a serious and responsible man. He works in the construction industry laying floors, building rustic wooden ceilings, fences and entire houses. He has worked in masonry for 3 years. He previously worked in a construction company but decided to start his own independent business as he thinks that in this way he can improve his own and his family's economic well-being as his family represents the most important thing in his life. This is why he came to us to realize the purchase of raw materials to continue working. He sees in his project the possibility of increasing his revenue, allowing him to provide his family with greater economic stability.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for building.

loans.name: Badolo Group

texts.fr:
Mme Alice est la représentante du groupe B.. Elle est marie et mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 10ans et le moins âgé a 04ans. Les 03 vont à l’école. Elle a 05 personnes en charge.

Elle fait la restauration de riz et du tôt (plat du Burkina) depuis 04ans. Elle  s’approvisionne dans les boutiques au secteur 17 pour acheter des sacs de riz et de maïs. Ses clients sont les voisins, amis et alentours.

Elle veut s’acheter, 01 sac de riz, 01 sac de maïs qu’elle transforme en farine pour la préparation du tôt, un demi (1/2) camion de bois de chauffe.

Mme économise pour l’occupation de la famille et de la scolarité de ses enfants. Elle ambitionne ouvrir un grand restaurant.
texts.en: Ms. Alice is the representative of the group B.. She is a married mother of three children. The oldest child is 10 years old, and the youngest is 4. The three children go to school She has five persons to support. She has had a business serving rice and tôt (a dish in Burkina Faso) for four years. She gets her supplies of rice and corn from shops in sector 17. Her customers are neighbors, friends, and those nearby. She wants to buy a sack of rice and a sack of corn that she processes into flour for making tôt. She also wants to buy a half-truckload of firewood. Ms. Alice is saving money to take care of the family and her children's schooling. Her ambition is to open a large restaurant.

loans.use: to buy a sack of rice and sack of corn to process into flour for making "tot"; and a half-truckload of firewood

loans.name: Sonangnon 2 De Wega-Vivotin Group

texts.fr:
Composée de 5 membres, le groupement SONANGNON 2, est dirigé par Charlotte. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Charlotte réside en location avec son mari qui est un chauffeur. Couturière de formation, Charlotte a associé à son activité la vente de liqueurs, des produits de mercerie et des produits alimentaires. Sa clientèle est composée des habitants de sa zone et de ses environs. Elle s'approvisionne dans le marché international du Bénin. Elle est à son 1er crédit à FINADEV. Parce que sa clientèle va grandissante, Charlotte a décidé de renouveler son micro crédit pour combler les attentes de sa clientèle. Elle pourra tirer de ce prêt de revenus supplémentaire qui pourront l'aider à assurer la survie de ses enfants et à offrir un confort plus agréable à sa famille. 
Charlotte est en caution solidaire avec 4 autres membres qui mènent comme activités respectives : 
* La production et vente de savons,liqueurs,
* La couture,
* La vente de CD,crédits et accessoires de portables,
* La coiffure et vente de mèches.
texts.en:
Group SONANGNON 2 is made up of 5 members, and run by Charlotte. She's married and the mother of five children, who all attend school. She lives in a rented home with her husband, a driver.

She's a trained seamstress, and also sells liquors, notion supplies and food products. Her clientele is composed of people from her area and its surroundings. She gets her supplies from an international marketplace in Benin.

Charlotte is on her first loan from Kiva's partner, FINADEV. Since her clientele is getting larger, she decided to renew her micro loan in order to meet customer demand. This will enable her to increase her income, and help her ensure the survival of her children and improve the comfort of her family. 

The businesses of the other members of the solidarity group consist in : making and selling soaps and liquors, sewing, selling CDs, mobile phone accessories and credits, and hairdressing and selling hair extensions.

loans.use: to buy 10 boxes of sardines

loans.name: Milagrosa Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MILAGROSA” iniciará su quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Los Andes, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Pascuala. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tejido de chompas, producción de sombreros, venta de ropa, tienda de barrio, vendedor de productos delicia, tejido de enaguas.

La señora Pascuala, indica que hace dos años que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una compañera amiga. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de artesanías (tejido de chompas) que viene trabajando hace cinco años atrás aprendiendo el mismo en un centro de aprendizaje.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de la feria 16 de Julio y que posteriormente lo comercializa a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella casada y tiene siete hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de capacitación.
texts.en:
The Milagrosa Communal Bank will begin its fifth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of its focus on the Andes.  It is made up of 9 members and it is led by a board of directors that is headed by Pascuala.  The communal bank members have many different businesses, such as knitting sweaters, making hats, selling clothing, running corner stores, selling Delicia brand products, and knitting skirts.

Pascuala has worked for Pro Mujer for two years and she joined the institution because she was invited to by a friend.  She currently has a handicrafts business knitting sweaters that she has been working at for five years.  She learned how to run this business at a training center.

The loan she is taking out now is to increase her working capital to buy wool that she will get at the Festival of La Paz on July 16 and that she will later sell on request.  This kind of work allows her to generate resources to support her family, as she is married with seven children.

When asked what it is she likes about Pro Mujer, her response is that she likes the training area.

loans.use: to buy wool

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nancy Lucila

texts.es:
Nancy tiene 30 años es casada y tiene 3 hijos, vive con su familia en Salcedo que se encuentra a 20 minutos de Latacunga en el centro de Ecuador. Nancy se considera una persona responsable y respetuosa.

Trabaja con su familia cultivando su terreno, es el cuarto crédito que le solicita a Fodemi este último será utilizado para la compra de semillas de fréjol para sembrar y después de su cocecha poder vender.

Su sueño es poder entrar al negocio de la crianza de ganado.
texts.en:
Nancy is 30 years old and has 3 children. She lives with her family in Salcedo which is 20 minutes from Latacunga in the centre of Ecuador. Nancy considers herself to be a responsible and respectful person.

She works with her family cultivating their land. This is the 4th loan that she requests from FODEMI and it will be used to buy bean seeds for sowing and selling after the harvest.

Her dream is to be able to start a livestock raising business.

loans.use: to buy bean seeds for sowing.

loans.name: Mirson

texts.es: Mirson, de 44 años, es padre soltero de un hijo que ya es mayor de edad y tiene su propia familia, el vive solo en su casa propia en donde algunas veces llegan sus hermanas y su hijo a visitarlo o pasar un fin de semana con él. El trabajo de Mirson consiste en la siembra de productos regionales, como cítricos, además posee algunos reses, los cuales se dedica a comprarlos en edad tierna y venderlos cuando ya están grandes y robusto. Todas estas actividades los realiza en su chacra, que esta ubicado a pocos kilómetros de su casa. Lleva en este trabajo ya 15 años, en ocaciones contrata peones para ayudarlo en época de siembra y cosecha. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que esta siempre al aire libre y dispone de su tiempo como mejor le parece, además dice que no hay nada mejor que ser independiente, espera poder mantener su negocio ya que de esto vive y espera poder seguir haciéndolo por varios años mas. Este será el crédito número 16 con MFP, le va muy bien en el grupo, es un socio fundador y siempre resultó ser buen pagador de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado, comprará productos regionales de otras chacras para venderlas al por mayor en la ciudad, además de invertir en algunos granos y sacos de abono para su sembríos.
texts.en:
Mirson is 44 years old and a single father of a son who is now an adult and has his own family. He lives alone in his own house where he is sometimes visited by his sisters and son. They sometimes come to spend the weeekend with him. Mirson plants regional products such as citrus trees. He also has some cattle which he buys when they are young and sells where they are large and strong. All of these activities take place on his farm which is located only a few kilometres from his house. He has been doing this work for 15 years. On occasion he hires labourers to help him at sowing and reaping time. What he likes about his work is that he is always in the open air and can use his time as he sees fit. In addition, he says that there is nothing better than being independent. He hopes to stay in business as he lives from it and hopes to continue doing same for several years more. This is his 16th loan with MFP. He is doing very well in the group, is a founding member and always proved to be good at repaying his loan. With the requested amount, he will buy local products from other farms to sell wholesale in the city and in addition invest in some grains and sacks of manure for his crops.

.

loans.use: to buy local products, grains and sacks of manure.

loans.name: Arco Iris 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en: Ambrocia leads this loan group, which is called Arco Iris (Rainbow) 1, 2 & 3. The members live in the slums located to the north of Santo Domingo. She makes her home in a simple structure with her two children and her long-term partner. She is excited to be taking out her first loan with Esperanza. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business, which is selling shoes, clothing, and cosmetics. She will use the profits to expand her business and improve her family's life. Her most difficult challenge has been providing her children with various items they need. She enjoys her work and is known for having a clean, well-organized home. Like everyone in this group, she is committed to improve her family's life and she thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more product to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy goods to sell

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena has been selling plantain in Jukwa for over 20 years. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy more plantain from Techiman. Abena is divorced and has seven children and so she is entirely responsible for providing for her family.

loans.use: to buy more plantain

loans.name: Sarita Colonia Group

texts.es: Así como las mujeres también existen hombres emprendedores este es el caso del señor Hugo de 64 años de edad,  su vida ha sido ejemplo y practica constante de un ferro espíritu de lucha, fundamentada en un profundo respeto por los valores; aspectos que se reflejan en su vida diaria. Pertenece al grupo Sarita Colonia con 6 integrantes, el cual lleva ese nombre en honor a la santa de la zona, el esta en el grupo ya 3 años. Hugo es un hombre casado, con cinco hijos, todos mayores de edad, el tiene un colegio es el director y docente de matemáticas, comenzó con 2 aulas y ahora tiene 7 aulas mas gracias a su esfuerzo junto con su esposa se pusieron una meta por cumplir y un desafío por realizar la mejoría económica de su hogar. Con el préstamo desea hacer  una inversión en mejorar las aulas del colegio.
texts.en: Just as there are entrepreneurial women, there are also entrepreneurial men. This is the case with Hugo, age 64. His life has been a constant practice and example of an iron-clad spirit of determination, rooted in a profound respect for values. These characteristics are reflected in his daily life. He belongs to the Sarita Colonia group with 6 members, which carries this name in honor of the patron saint of the area. Hugo has been in the group for 3 years. He is a married man with five children, all of them grown. He has a school, and he is the director and mathematics teacher. He started with 2 classrooms, and now he has 7 more classrooms, thanks to his efforts. Together with his wife, they set a goal to fulfill and a challenge to achieve economic improvement for their household. With the loan, he wants to make an investment in improving the school's classrooms.

loans.use: to invest in improving the classrooms of his school.

loans.name: Afia

texts.en: Afia lives in Jukwa. She completed senior high school and has been selling maize in bulk for the last 10 years.  Afia will use the majority of the loan money to buy maize to sell. She is married and has three children. She uses the remaining profits to support her husband in taking take care of the home.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bags of maize to sell.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy, de 49 años, es una mujer alegre y muy trabajadora, es conviviente con su pareja con quien tiene dos hijos quienes ya son mayores. Juntos viven en su casa propia. EL trabajo de Nancy comienza muy temprano, pues ella se dirige al mercado de "Campo Verde" (un distrito de la ciudad) en donde tiene que abrir su puesto muy temprano, en el vende hielo, frutas, plátano, y otros productos regionales, lleva trabajando en esto ya por cuatro años aproximadamente, lo hace sola y es muy conocida por que vende muy buenos productos. Lo que le gusta de trabajo es que tiene tiempo para poder hacer otras actividades, ya que su trabajo en el mercado es solo por las mañanas. Espera mas adelante poder amplair su puesto de venta. Este será el séptimo crédito con MFP, se siente muy cómoda en su grupo por que todos demostraron ser muy responsables, espera poder seguir recibiendo la ayuda brindada ya que dice le es de mucha ayuda para seguir creciendo en su negocio. Con el monto solicitado, comprará productos como plátanos, cítricos para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en: Nancy, 49, is a cheerful, hard-working woman who has a common-law husband and two adult children.  They live in their own house.  Nancy's work begins very early in the morning when she goes to the market in "Campo Verde" (a city district) where she has a stall.  She sells ice, fruit, bananas and other regional products, and has been in business for approximately four years.  She works alone and is well known because of the quality products she sells.  What she enjoys about her work is the fact that it leaves time for her to have other activities.  This is because she only works in the mornings.  Her goal is to get ahead through her sales.  This will be her seventh loan through MFP and she is very comfortable in her group because of how responsible the people are.  She hopes to continue receiving support so she can expand her business.  The loan will be used to buy products such as bananas and citrus fruits.

loans.use: To buy bananas and citrus fruits.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena lives in Jukwa with her husband, who is a mason, and their children. For the last 12 years, Abena has been selling cooked banku with hot pepper sauce (fermented corn/cassava mixed into dough). She is requesting a loan money to purchase maize, fresh tomatoes, peppers, and onions. She will use the profits to support her husband and educate, feed, and clothe her children.

loans.use: to purchase maize, fresh tomatoes, peppers, and onions.

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en: Adwoa is married and has five children. For the last five years she has sold raw beans, ground nuts, and rice in Jukwa, which is in Ghana’s central region. Adwoa is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase cereals to sell. With the profits, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase cereals to sell.

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en: Akosua lives in Jukwa in Ghana’s central region. She is divorced and has two children. After completing junior high school Akosua became a seamstress; which she has been doing for seven years. Akosua uses her income to support her family. She is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchse sewing materials.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials.

loans.name: Adriana Yolanda

texts.es: La Sra. Adriana es  una persona  muy responsable  y se preocupa por   el   bienestar  de  su  familia,  en este  momento  ella  requiere   de  nuestra  ayuda  para   hacerle   frente   a  los   gastos  escolares  de su  hija  ya  que  como  inician   nuevo periodo  escolar   requiere  realizar  la  compra  de  uniformes  y  útiles  escolares, ve  en  el crédito la posibilidad  de  ofrecer  a  su  pequeña  la  oportunidad  de  estudiar   por  lo que  esta  muy  contenta por  habernos  encontrado,  ya  que el estudio es  la  mayor  herencia que  le  puede  dejar  a su pequeña,  en esta  ocasión su  hija no  pudo  salir  en la   fotografía  ya  que  estaba  en  horario  de  escuela.
texts.en: Adriana is a very responsible person who worries about her family’s wellbeing. She currently needs our help to pay for school fees for her daughter. As the new school years is about to begin, she needs to buy uniforms and school supplies. She thinks the loan will offer to her young one the chance to study, and she is very happy about it because this is the best assets she can offer to her daughter. Her daughter could not be photographed with her for this occasion because she was at school when the picture was taken.

loans.use: To pay for school fees and to buy uniforms and school supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase materials to sew and sell.

loans.name: Filipenses 4:13 Group

texts.en: Iris leads this loan group, which is called Filipenses 4:13 (Philippians). The group is maD. up of 10 women who run their own businesses in the town of Puerto Plata, a tourist center in the north of the country. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her two children and their father. She earns a living by running a beauty salon, and is excited to be taking out her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid two previous loans and using them to expand her business. She started her business eight years ago after spending one year working for a friend while becoming a beautician. She plans to use her portion of this loan to buy beauty products and another hair dryer. She will use the profits she earns to buy her children school supplies and invest in her business. Her main challenge is paying rent, and she dreams one day of buying her own home. She enjoys working for her family and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and a hair dryer.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: For the last four years Juliana worked as a hair dresser in Jukwa, a small village in Ghana’s central region. Now she has returned to an earlier line of work, selling children's clothes. She is married to a farmer and they have two children. Juliana will use this loan from CRAN and Kiva to buy sewing supplies, more clothes to sell and care for her home.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice has eight children, is married to a farmer and lives in the village of Jukwa. She completed high school and has for the last five years earned a living by making items for people to eat. She and her husband use their incomes to provide their children with clothing, food and schooling. Alice is applying for this loan to buy more ingredients to use to make food for her customers. She plans to use some of the additional income she earns to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for a food business.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena is a widow with five children. For the past 11 years she has been selling palm oil in Jukwa. Abena uses the loan money to buy more palm oil to sell. The loan will make a great difference to her as she struggles financially with having to provide solely for her family. Abena hopes to be able to keep reinvesting in order to maintain her business.

loans.use: to buy more palm oil to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth lives and works in Jukwa selling cloth. After completing senior high school she started her business and she has now been selling cloth for 14 years. She hopes to use the loan money to buy cloth to sell and the profits to feed and support her two children. She plans to reinvest back into her business for further growth.

loans.use: to buy cloth to sell

loans.name: Maria Cleofe

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “SOLIDARIDAD-CACHIMAYO” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Tambo Real, en la Provincia de Anta y Departamento de Cusco.  

La socia Cleofe;  La socia tiene 35 años de edad, la socia es casada y tiene 3 hijos la socia es ganadera y tiene vacas, y animales menores, la socia tiene también toros 2 de ellos y vacas 9, la socia trabaja vendiendo específicamente leche y queso, la socia tiene un stand en un conocido centro en la ciudad de Cusco, ella trae sus productos para la venta los fines de semana, la socia requiere el préstamo para invertir en la compra de alimento para sus ganados, ella también desea comprar sales minerales a sus ganados. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de sales minerales y alimento para sus ganados vacunos.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Introducing Cleofe, a member of “SOLIDARIDAD-CACHIMAYO” (Cachimayo Solidarity), a communal bank located in Tambo Real, a district of the province of Anta in the Cusco department.

Cleofe is 35 years old, she is married and she has 3 children. She is a cattle farmer and she owns cows and small animals. She also has 2 bulls and 9 cows. She sells milk and cheese in a stand located in a well-known shopping center in the town of Cusco. Every week-end she brings her products to the stall to sell them. She is requesting a loan to invest in in the purchase of feed for her cattle. She also wants to buy mineral salts for her cattle. She is requesting a loan to invest it in the purchase of mineral salts and feed for her cows.

She is grateful for the support she will receive and at the same time she commits to complying with fully repaying her dues.

loans.use: To buy feed and mineral salts for her cows.

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “SOLIDARIDAD-CACHIMAYO” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Tambo Real, en la Provincia de Anta y Departamento de Cusco.  

La socia Leonarda; 34 años de edad, la socia tiene 3 hijos y es soltera, la socia se dedica  a la atención de su tienda de abarrotes desde hace 9 años, la socia también es ganadera, la socia tiene sus vacas y toros, ella también cría chanchos, en esta ocasión la socia desea invertir en la compra de chanchos y de una vaca el crédito esperado, la socia desea incrementar el número de animales vacunos para la venta de los productos lácteos. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de una vaca y un par de chanchos.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Introducing Leonarda, a member of “SOLIDARIDAD-CACHIMAYO” (Cachimayo Solidarity), a communal bank located in Tambo Real, a district of the province of Anta in the Cusco department.

Leonarda is 34 years old, she is single and has 3 children. She has been engaged in managing her grocery store for 9 years, and she is also a livestock breeder. She owns cows and bulls, and she also breeds pigs. She wants to invest the loan she has requested in the purchase of pigs and of a cow: she wants to increase the number of cows to sell dairy products. She is requesting a loan to invest it in the purchase of a cow and of a pair of pigs.

She is grateful for the support she will receive and at the same time she commits to complying with fully repaying her dues.

loans.use: To buy a cow and a pair of pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beans, palm oil, gari (casava grain) and ripped plantain to cook to sell.

loans.name: Koko

texts.en: Koko is married and lives with their five children in the village of Jukwa in Ghana’s Central Region. For the past 15 years Koko has worked selling baked bread. Koko will use the loaned money to buy flour, sugar, salt and other ingredients. After supporting her family, she hopes to use the remaining profits to reinvest back into her business to sustain her work and strive for further growth.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, salt and other ingredients to make bread.

loans.name: Ricarda

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “SOLIDARIDAD-CACHIMAYO” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Tambo Real, en la Provincia de Anta y Departamento de Cusco. 

La socia Ricarda; La socia tiene 43 años de edad, la socia es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos, la socia se dedica  a la venta de comidas caseras, la socia también es ganadera y tiene vacas 4 y ella vende leche cuando extrae la leche de sus vacas, la socia vende a sus amistades, la socia también prepara queso por las tardes para la venta y consumo, y también hace chicha blanca y junto a las comidas caseras que elabora, lleva a vender a un colegio al personal administrativo y a algunos alumnos que desean comprar, la socia trabaja en todo lo que puede dedicando todo su tiempo a ello, para poder terminar de construir su vivienda y de dar mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos, la socia también lleva gaseosas al colegio para media mañana cuando el calor esta fuerte. La socia desea el crédito para invertir en la compra de gaseosas y productos como arroz, aceite, fideos y otros para la elaboración de las comidas caseras. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de gaseosas y productos para preparar comidas caseras.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Introducing Ricarda, a member of “SOLIDARIDAD-CACHIMAYO” (Cachimayo Solidarity), a communal bank located in Tambo Real, a district of the province of Anta in the Cusco department. 

Ricarda is 43 years old, she lives with her life partner and she has 4 children. On top of selling homemade food, she also engages in cattle breeding: she has 4 cows and she sells their milk to her friends. In the evenings she prepares cheese both for personal consumption and to sell it; she also prepares chica blanca*, and she sells it together with her homemade dishes to the administrative staff of the school as well as to some students who wants to buy it. Working takes up all of her time, and she works as much as she can in order to finish building her house and to offer a better standard of living to her children. She also sells fizzy drinks to the schools to sell them at noon when the heat is intense. She is requesting a loan to invest it in the purchase of fizzy drinks and products such as rice, oil and noodles to prepare her homemade dishes. She is requesting a loan to buy fizzy drinks and ingredients she needs to prepare her homemade dishes.

She is grateful for the support she will receive and at the same time she commits to complying with fully repaying her dues.

*Chicha blanca is a the sweet unfermented variety of chicham, a corn-based drink very popular in Peru. It is made with white corn and cinammon.(http://www.gourmetsleuth.com/Articles/Ethnic-Unique-Foods-Ingredients-645/chicha.aspx)

loans.use: To buy fizzy drinks and ingredients to prepare her dishes.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Alicia tiene 40 años, es una mujer muy amable, alegre y trabajadora, convive con su pareja con quien es madre de dos hijos de 18 y 14 años, quienes dependen de ella para terminen de estudiar. Juntos viven en casa de su madre junto a ella a quien acompañan y brindan los cuidado necesarios. Alicia, tiene un trabajo muy pesado, se dedica a la venta de carne de cerdo en una mercado local (mercado Bellavista). Ella se levanta muy temprano para ir al matadero de cerdo, en donde ya un día antes deja haciendo el pedido correspondiente, de ahí lleva la carne de cerdo a su puesto ubicado en la cuadra 6 del mercado, antes se dedicaba a la venta de pescado pero como le gusta iniciar con nuevos retos, emprendió con el trabajo que hasta ahora sigue realizando, trabaja sola y lleva ya ocho años en este trabajo. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene siempre a su lado compañeros de ventas buenos y amables y que siempre están a la expectativa de lo que sucede, el negocio le va bien, y espera mas adelante poner una bodega en su casa para que así sus hijos le ayuden en los ingresos del hogar. Este será el crédito número doce con MFP, el grupo que conforma le agrada mucho ya que son muy responsables y siempre están cumpliendo. Agradece la oportunidad que le dieron para poder aumentar su inversión y espera poder seguir trabajando para así progresar. Con el monto solicitado, comprará carne para abastecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Alicia is 40 years old and is a very happy, friendly and hard-working woman.  She lives with her partner with whom she has two children, ages 18 and 14.  Her children as still dependent on her so they can finish their studies.  They live together in her mother's house as they provide her with the companionship and the care she needs.  

Alicia has a very difficult job.  She sells pork at the local market (Bellavista market).  She gets up very early to go to the slaughterhouse, where she had placed her order the day before, and from there she takes the meat to her stand located in the 6th block of the market.  She used to sell fish but since she likes to take on new challenges she started this job.  She works alone and has been doing this job for 8 years.  What she likes about her job is that she always has good and friendly sales partners around her and that they are always keeping an eye on things.  Things are going well with her business and she hopes that in the future she will be able to set up a shop in her house so that her children can help with the household income.  

This will be her twelfth loan with MFP.  She is grateful to the group that she belongs to as they are responsible and always fulfill their obligations.  She is also grateful for the opportunity to be able to increase her investment and hopes to be able to continue working so she can get ahead.  With the amount requested, she will buy meat to stock her business.

loans.use: purchase meat.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce A. is divorced and has two children. They live in the village of Jukwa near to Cape Coast in Ghana’s central region. After completing junior high school, Joyce began to sell bread and tea which she has now done for the past year. Joyce uses the loan money gained through Kiva to purchase more beverages to prepare and sell. Her most profitable time of the day is the morning when people passing by purchase bread and tea from her for their breakfast. With the profits from her business she is able to support her family. Any remaining income she then tries to save to reinvest back into the business.

loans.use: to purchase more beverages to prepare and sell.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “SOLIDARIDAD-CACHIMAYO” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito D. Tambo Real, en la Provincia D. Anta y Departamento D. Cusco. 

La socia Juliana; La socia tiene 60 años D. edad; la socia es casada y tiene 6 hijos  todos ellos independientes; la socia se dedica  a la agricultura ya  la ganadería, la socia apoya a sus hijos con el cuidado D. sus nietos y también prepara quesos y venD. leche, la socia trae desD. Tambo Real los fines D. semana la leche y quesos para la venta en su stand en un mercado muy famosos en la ciudad del Cusco, ella requiere en esta ocasión el crédito para invertir en la compra D. alimento y sales minerales para sus vacas y D. este modo producir a mejor calidad y cantidad D. leche.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir D. manera disciplinada con los pagos D. las cuotas.
texts.en:
Introducing Juliana, a member of “SOLIDARIDAD-CACHIMAYO” (Cochimayo Solidarity), a communal bank located in Tambo Real, a district of the province of Anta in the Cusco department.

Juliana is 60 years old, she is married and she has 6 children, all economically independent. She engages in agriculture and livestock breeding. She helps her children by taking care of her grandchildren, and she also prepares cheese and sells milk. Every week-end she brings milk and cheese from Tambo Real to sell them in her stand located in a very famous market in the town of Cusco. She is requesting a loan to invest it in the purchase of food and mineral salts for her cows, in order to be able to producer more milk of better quality.

She is grateful for the support she will receive and at the same time she commits to complying with fully repaying her dues.

loans.use: To buy food and mineral salts for her cows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fresh fish to fry for sale.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en: Sophia is a hairdresser and sells hair products in Jukwa. Since finishing junior high school she has working in this industry for four years. Sophia is married to a driver and they have two children. The profits from her business combined with her husband’s income are used to support their family. The loan will help considerably in helping Sophia to obtain hair creams, oils and shampoo for the business.

loans.use: to obtain hair creams, oils and shampoo for the business.

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “SOLIDARIDAD-CACHIMAYO” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Tambo Real, en la Provincia de Anta y Departamento de Cusco.
La socia Ernestina; La socia tiene 40 años, la socia es casada y tiene 3 hijos, la socia se dedica a la ganadería, la socia tiene vacas lecheras y ella vende los derivados de la leche, la socia se dedica a vender quesos, leche, mantequilla, ella lleva  a las ferias en los poblados sus productos, la socia requiere en esta ocasión desea invertir el préstamo en el transporte y alimentación de sus ganados, también la socia invertirá el préstamo en la compra de vitaminas y minerales para sus ganados vacunos. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de alimentos para sus ganados y vitaminas.
La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Introducing Ernestina, a member of “SOLIDARIDAD-CACHIMAYO” (Cachimayo Solidarity), a communal bank located in Tambo Real, a district of the province of Anta in the Cusco department.
Ernestina is 40 years old, she is married and she has 3 children. She in a cattle breeder: she owns dairy cows and she sells dairy products such as cheese, milk and butter, taking her products to the fairs in the villages. She is requesting a loan to invest it in the transportation and feeding of her cattle, and she will also buy vitamins and mineral salts for her cows. She is requesting a loan to invest it in the purchase of food and vitamins for her cattle.
She is grateful for the support she will receive and at the same time she commits to complying with fully repaying her dues.

loans.use: To buy food and vitamins for her cattle.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort is a widow who has two children. After completing senior high school 15 years ago, she has been selling wakye (rice and beans) to people in the village of Jukwa. The loan money will help Comfort to buy beans, rice, tomatoes, pepper to make wakye and to support her family, especially as she is the sole breadwinner. 

Wakye is a traditional rice dish in Ghana. To prepare wakye, she gets her beans, rice, and colored leaves from the market. She cooks the beans until they become tender and adds the colored leaves to give them a reddish color. Then she adds the rice to the bean mixture. She cooks the rice and beans until they become tender to eat.

Wakye is normally eaten with macaroni, wele (cow skin), gari, salad with pepper sauce, tomatoes sauce, fish, or meat.

loans.use: to buy beans, rice, tomatoes, pepper to make wakye

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “SOLIDARIDAD-CACHIMAYO” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Tambo Real, en la Provincia de Anta y Departamento de Cusco.  
La socia Norma; La socia tiene 43 años de edad; la socia es casada y tiene 4  hijos; La socia se dedica  a la atención de sus vacas, ella tiene ganados vacunos, la socia trabaja vendiendo leche, ella reparte la leche a sus amistades y cuando se le acumula la lleva a la feria en los poblados aledaños a Tambo Real; la socia desea el crédito para invertir en la compra de sales minerales para sus ganados, ella tiene 20 vacas lecheras y 3 toros, la socia también tiene animales menores. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de sales minerales para sus ganados.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Introducing Norma, a member of “SOLIDARIDAD-CACHIMAYO” (Cachimayo Solidarity), a communal bank located in Tambo Real, a district of the province of Anta in the Cusco department.
Norma is 43 years old, she is married and she has 4 children. She breeds cows and tends to them. She sells milk, distributing a part of it to her friends, and taking the exceeding quantities to the fair in the neighboring villages in Tambo Real. She is requesting a loan to invest it in the purchase of mineral salts for her animals. She has 20 dairy cows and 3 bulls, and she also keeps small animals. She is requesting a loan to invest it in the purchase of mineral salts for her animals.
She is grateful for the support she will receive and at the same time she commits to complying with fully repaying her dues.

loans.use: To buy mineral salts for her cattle.

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: Vida lives with her husband who is a security officer and their three children. For the past 11 years, she has worked cooking and selling koko (porridge) in Jukwa, which is a village in Ghana’s central region. The profits from her business are used to support her family. The loan will enable her buy millet, sugar and milk to prepare porridge for sale. She is therefore very grateful for the support of the lenders.

loans.use: buy millet, sugar and milk to prepare porridge for sale.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 33 años, es una mujer amable y muy responsable, es madre soltera de un niño de ocho años. Juntos viven en su casa propia. Su mayor anhelo es darle una buena educación a su hijo. EL trabajo de Rosa es el de servicio de costura, dicho trabajo lo realiza en su casa, en ella sus clientes la visitan para que realicen alguna confección de una prenda. Ella es muy creativa y termina elaborando prendas con novedosos diseños.  ella posee dos maquinas de coser y una remalladora, la segunda maquina y la remalladota se pudo comprar con los primeros crédito que solicitó a la institución. Lleva ya diez años en este trabajo, cuando no hay mucha demanda trabaja sola y cuando necesita que le ayuden por la demanda de sus prendas se ve obligada a contratar a dos personas más que saben del trabajo y son buenos en la costura. A Rosa siempre le gusto la costura, le gusta mucho su trabajo, le agrada tener sus creaciones y saber que es libre en hacer sus diseños, y casi siempre sus clientes están ahí para solicitarle su servicio. Espera poner un taller de costura implementado y empezar a hacer confecciones más grandes. Este será el octavo crédito con MFP, hasta ahora le ha ido bien en su grupo y esta contenta de trabajar con ellos porque demostraron todos que son muy responsables, además esta muy agradecida por la oportunidad de invertir en su negocio. Con el monto solicitado, comprará telas, hilos, blondas, cierres.
texts.en: Rosa, 33, is a kind, responsible woman and a single mother of an 8-year-old boy.  They live in their own house.  Her greatest desire is to give her son a good education.  Rosa works as a seamstress in her house where her customers come to place their  orders.  She is very creative and gives all her work novel designs.  She has two sewing machines and an overlock machine.  The second sewing machine and the overlock were purchased with the first loan she had through the institution.  She has been in business for ten years and works alone when demand is low.  When she has many orders she has to hire two people who know their work well and have sewing expertise.  Rosa has always enjoyed sewing and knowing that she is free to create her own designs.  She hopes to set up her own sewing shop one day and produce larger things.  This will be her eighth loan through MFP.  She is happy working with her group because all the members are responsible.  She is very grateful for the opportunity to invest in her business.  The loan will be used to buy fabric, thread, lace and closures.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread and notions (closures).

loans.name: Kyei

texts.en: Kyei has been making palm oil extract and koko in the village of Jukwa for the past 11 years. She is married to a cleaner. The CRAN loan received through Kiva will enable Kyei to continue purchasing palm fruits to make the oil to sell. After using the profits to take care of their home, she tries to save money to reinvest into the business for further growth.

loans.use: to puirchase palm fruits to make oil to sell.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: For the last year, Theresa has walked around the village of Jukwa selling eggs, tiger-nuts and groundnuts from a basket perched on top of her head.  Theresa’s dream is to expand her business. The loan will help her to continue buying groundnut, tiger-nut and other products to sell. The profits are used to pay for food and to maintain her home.

loans.use: to continue buying groundnut, tiger-nut and others to sell.

loans.name: Safo

texts.en: Safo is married to a cleaner and they have five children. After receiving schooling until the end of junior high school, Safo began selling gari (cassava flour) and maize in Jukwa, which she has now done for 25 years. Safo is grateful to the lenders for helping her to maintain her business to continue buying more bags of maize to sell. She has been able to assist her husband in supporting their family.

loans.use: to continue buying more bags of maize to sell

loans.name: San Lorenzo Group

texts.es:
La formación el presente comité se inicio gracias a la iniciativa D. la Señora Olinda, quien vive en la ciudad D. Carapeguá. San Lorenzo fue denominado el comité que actualmente se encuentra trabajando muy a gusto ya en el tercer ciclo del programa D. mujeres emprendedoras, con 9 integrantes. Es un grupo D. señoras muy responsables y trabajadoras que diariamente luchan por dar a sus familias lo mejor.
La señora Olinda se dedica a la venta D. pollos, nos cuenta que tiene muchas ventas por lo que su negocio le trae buenas ganancias. Gracias a este trabajo ella ha podido mantener a su familia y paliar todos los gastos que diariamente surgen. Comenta que todo el sacrificio que realiza es por sus seres queridos, ya que desea darles lo mejor y que no tengan privaciones.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. pollos, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y también cumplir con la demanda D. sus clientes. Da las gracias a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le brinda.
texts.en:
The formation of the current communal bank was initiated thanks to the initiative of Señora Olinda who lives in the city of Carapeguá. The group is called San Lorenzo and is currently working very well and is in its 3rd cycle of the women entrepreneurs program with 9 members. This is a group of very responsible and hardworking women who struggle on a daily basis to give their families the best they can.

Señora Olinda sells chickens. She tells us that she has so many sales that the business brings her good earnings. Thanks to this job she has been able to take care of her family and offset all the expenses that arise daily. She says that all the sacrifice she makes is for her loved ones as she wants to give them the best and ensure that they suffer no hardship.

She is asking for the loan to buy chickens to replenish stocks and also meet customer demand. She gives the Fundacion her thanks for the opportunity this gives her.

loans.use: to buy chickens to replenish stocks  and for subsequent sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her business and buy more products

loans.name: Jose Miguel

texts.es:
JOSE MIGUEL tiene 29 años de edad  es soltero no tiene hijos vive con los  padres en Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.
Es integrante de la VRC Virgen de Guadalupe se encuentra ubicada en la Ciudadela 10 de noviembre, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedica  a labores comerciales.

José se dedica a la   venta de  calzado para damas y caballeros, la compra de la mercadería la realiza en  la Ciudad de Huaquillas y las vende en Ventanas. Solicita el crédito para  incrementar el negocio, comprar más  mercadería y obtener más utilidades.

El crédito le será de mucha ayuda para poder tener mejores ingresos y aportar económicamente para la compra de alimentación y transporte.

Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuentemente es la competencia  que lo ha sabido manejar eficientemente  para poder  vender el calzado.
El sueño es poder comprarse un local para poder exibir la mercadería y vender los productos.
En los tiempos libres le gusta mucho escuchar música y disfrutar de las fiestas patronales.
texts.en:
José Miguel is 29 years old, single, and doesn't have any children.  He lives with his parents in Ventanas, in Los Ríos province.  He is a member of the Virgen de Guadalupe community bank which is located in 10 de Noviembre district, in Ventanas canton.

José sells men's and women's footwear.  He buys his merchandise in the town of Huaquillas and sells it in Ventanas.  He is requesting this loan to increase his business, buy more merchandise and make more profits.

This loan will be a great help to José in making better income and will help him to contribute financially towards buying food and paying for transportation.

The challenge that José very frequently faces is that of competition.  However, he has known how to deal with this effectively in order to sell his footwear.

José's dream is to buy premises where he can display his merchandise and sell his products.  In his free time, he really enjoys listening to music and enjoying local festivals.

loans.use: to increase his business and buy more merchandise

loans.name: Ruka Rayen Group

texts.es:
Éste Banco comunal se llama “Ruka Rayen” lo conforman 18 emprendedoras que se dedican a diferentes rubros, principalmente artesanía en madera y lana. Todos ellas pertenecientes a la ciudad de Temuco.
Miriam integrante del banco comunal quien en la foto se encuentra en la primera fila de pie, en el lugar de al medio, viste una chaqueta color beige y su cabello es ondeado y corto. 
Se dedica al rubro de la artesanía desde hace 30 años, específicamente tallado en madera, tejidos y telares en lana. 
Su mercadería usualmente la compra en una feria ubicada en la ciudad de Cauquenes ahí compra lanas, maderas y herramientas. Comenta que tiene un gran número de clientes, por lo que son conocidos, sus ventas durante el año las realiza en su mismo domicilio y durante la temporada de verano se instala con sus productos en una feria artesanal dentro de un gimnasio municipal. 
Con el crédito comprará lanas, para sus telares y tejidos. 	
Sus metas en su negocio son tener un local establecido, en el cual pueda ofrecer y vender sus productos de artesanía durante todo el año, en alguna zona turística. 
Miriam vive junto a su marido y sus tres hijos de 22, 20 y 7 años de edad, sus hijos mayores trabajan de manera dependiente. A ella le hubiese gustado haber estudiado la carrera de administración de empresas, comenta que ahora es más complicado, ya que debe trabajar.
Sus motivaciones de continuar con el negocio se deben a que sus ingresos le permiten ayudar a su familia y que estos le permitirán brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de los servicios brindados por Fondo esperanza, especialmente por el crédito, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. Comenta que la relación grupal es buena, ya que son solidarios y comprometidos con los demás emprendedores. Las capacitaciones le han servido para distribuir sus ingresos.
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Ruka Rayen”. It is made up of 18 entrepreneurs that work in different professions, mainly wood and fiber crafts.  They all live in the city of Temuco.  

Miriam is a member of the communal bank and is located standing in the middle of the front row.  She is wearing a beige jacket and has short, wavy hair.   

She has been working as an artisan for 30 years, specifically in wood carving and woolen fabrics and knits.  She usually buys her materials at a market in the city of Cauquenes.  There she buys wool, wood and tools.  She says that she has a large number of customers that she knows.  She makes her sales during the year from her house, but during the summer season she sets up and sells her products at a craft fair located in a municipal gymnasium. 

With the loan she will buy wool for her knits and fabrics.  Her goal is to have an established local for her business in a tourist area where she can offer and sell her crafts year-round. 

Miriam lives with her husband and three children, ages 22, 20 and 7.  Her older children work in a dependent manner.  She would have liked to have studied for a career in business administration, but she says that now it is too complicated as she has to work.  She is motivated to continue working at her business as her income helps her family and will allow her to give her children a better quality of life.  

She is very happy and grateful for the services that Fondo Esperanza has given her, especially the loan, since it has helped her to invest in her business.  She says that the group relationship is good since they are very supportive and committed to the other entrepreneurs and the training has helped her to allocate her income.  

Temuco is the capital of the region of Araucanía.  The city is located 670 km to the south of Santiago (the capital of Chile).  There are a series of lakeside resorts located on the outskirts (Pucón, Villarrica) and very striking native flora and fauna concentrated in the nature reserves nearby.  It is also worth noting that 50% of the Mapuche, indigenous people, that exist in our country live in this region.

loans.use: purchase wool for her fabrics and knits.

loans.name: Idalia Natividad

texts.es:
Idalia Natividad tiene 28 años de edad es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos de  cuatro y dos años de edad.
Es integrante de la VRC Virgen de Guadalupe se encuentra ubicada en la Ciudadela 10 de noviembre, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedica  a labores comerciales.

Idalia se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollos, la compra y venta lo realiza en Ventanas cada  mes y medio. El crédito lo solicita para poder  comprar más  pollos, remedios para poder combatir las enfermedades y  la alimentación.

El crédito le será de mucha ayuda para poder tener mejores ingresos y buena estabilidad económica. Los desafíos que se le presenta  es la muerte de los pollos por los virus y   males. 

El sueño es poder comprarse una camioneta para poder transportar los pollos a Ventanas y  poder venderlos.
En los tiempos libres le gusta mucho escuchar música y disfrutar de las fiestas patronales.
texts.en:
Idalia Natividad, 28, is married and lives with her husband and children, ages four and two.  She is a member of the communal bank Virgen de Guadalupe in the residential area of Ciudadela 10 de Noviembre in the Ventanas Canton.  She is a merchant.

Idalia raises and sells chickens, which she buys and sells in Ventanas every month and a half.  She is requesting a loan to buy more chickens, remedies to cure their illnesses and feed.

The loan will help improve her level of income and give her economic stability.  One of the challenges she is up against is the loss of chickens due to viruses and other illnesses.

Her dream is to buy a truck for transportation of the chickens to Ventanas where she sells them.

In her free time she enjoys listening to music and celebrating the patron saint festivities.

loans.use: To buy more chickens and remedies for their illnesses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more products, and increase her business.

loans.name: Las Rosas Blancas Group

texts.es: El Sr.  Williams   es conviviente, tiene 1 hijo, Williams  tiene 30 años D. edad  actualmente es integrante en L. alcancía comunal “Las Rosas Blancas” grupo  conformado por  7 socios que se dedican a diversas actividades D. comercio. Williams  trabaja junto a su esposa  desD. hace 5 años en una bodega que está situada en el mercado D. su distrito,  a su vez trabaja hasta el medio día  en una moto taxi  que es D. su propiedad y por las tardes alquiL. su mota taxi, y aprovechando el tiempo libre en L. tarD. trabaja  D. cobrador  hasta L. noche, estos negocios  surgen  a raíz del nacimiento D. su hijo,  es así que Williams trabajo muy duro para obtener lo que hoy en día tiene Williams nos cuenta que su motivacion son su hijo y sus esposa, gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación a logrado mejores ingresos económicos, ha comprado cosas para su hogar  y sobre todo su familia cuenta con una mejor calidad D. vida,  con el fin D. seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar insumos (Arroz, Fideos) para seguir implementando su bodega .Sabemos que Williams  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos D. Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en:
Señor Williams, aged 30, lives in a common-law marriage and is the father of a son. He is now a member of the communal bank "Las Rosas Blancas" (the white roses), a group of seven members who engage in various traD. activities.

Williams has been working for five years with his wife in a grocery store which is located at the market in his district. He also works until noon on a motortaxi that he owns. In the afternoon he rents it out, and thus has enough free time to work as a collector until nightfall. He began these activities when their son was born. Williams works very hard to get what he has today. He says that he is motivated by his son and his wife. Thanks to his effort and dedication he has a better income and can buy appliances for their home. His family has now a better quality of life. In order to ensure the continued growth of his grocery store, he applied for a new loan to buy some inventory (rice and noodles). Williams will meet his goals through hard work and effort, and the loans granted by the microfinance institution Edaprospo will help him.

loans.use: to buy inventory (rice and noodles) for his grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell later

loans.name: Los Robles Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LOS ROBLES” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Cascada, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Margarita. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: Hilado de fibra de vicuña, venta de abarrotes, pensión, venta de comida, tejido de buzos.

La señora Margarita,  indica hace un año y medio que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio artesanía que viene trabajando desde que se caso.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de fibra de vicuña), que comprara de de la feria de San Luís y posteriormente la elaboración lo venderá a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la el área de salud, de crédito y las compañeras.
texts.en:
The “Los Robles” (The Oaks) communal bank will start its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Cascada Center.  It has six members led by a governing board headed by Margarita.  The members carry out a variety of businesses.  Among them we have: vicuña wool weaving, grocery sales, food preparation and sales, sweat shirt making.
