She sells everything she harvests in the distribution centers located in the cities of San Francisco and Santa Rosa, where she receives better prices for all her crops.

What Luisa likes best about her work is planting her land, and she does it with painstaking care.  She has been doing this work for 12 years and she considers that the hardest part is transporting her crops, since cargo vehicles are scarce in this part of the jungle area of the Apurimac River Valley.  In time, she wants to buy more land, to increase production.

This will be Luisa's second loan with MFP.  She hopes to be able to achieve her goals with a small loan, for which she is prepared to make the respective repayment.  With the 3000 PEN requested she will acquire manure and natural fertilizers to improve her plants and so take good advantage of the crop.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and manure.

loans.name: Modesto

texts.es: Modesto, de 60 años, es un hombre sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Maura de 56 años y su hijo menor Roberto de 30 años, quien los apoya en la siembra y cosecha de sus cultivos. Los extensos campos de cacao, café y raíces de barbasco que posee Modesto, son el fruto de una vida de arduo trabajo y de una firme convicción de sobresalir en la vida, sus productos son muy solicitados en distintas entidades acopiadoras de productos agrícolas, ya que su fama de cosechar cultivos de calidad le ayuda a vender sus productos a muy buenos precios. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que cuenta con la plena libertad de transitar por sus áreas verdes y trabajar a su manera. Lleva 40 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, ya que son muy pesados y le fatigan mucho, pero gracias al apoyo de su hijo continuo con su trabajo. Este será su octavo crédito con MFP, sabe que este dinero le será de mucha utilidad y agradece a los financistas por apoyarle con los créditos y en esta oportunidad espera seguir beneficiándose con el crédito. En su banco comunal es un socio muy alegre y siempre pone orden en las reuniones. Con los 2,500 nuevos soles comprará triciclos que le servirán como medio de transporte para trasladar sus productos.
texts.en: Modesto, 60, is a hardworking and unassuming man.  He lives in his own house with his wife, Maura, who is 56 years old, and his youngest child, Roberto, who is 30 and helps him with the planting and harvesting of his crops.  The extensive fields of cocoa, coffee and mullein roots that Modesto has are the fruit of a life of arduous work and a firm conviction to excel in life.  His products are sought after in the various agricultural collection centers, since he has a reputation for quality crops, and this helps him to sell his crops at very good prices.  What he likes most about his work is having the full freedom to move about his fields and work in his own way.  He has been farming for 40 years, and what he considers most difficult is having to transport his products, since they are very heavy and so this is very tiring.  But thanks to the support of his son, he has been able to continue with this work.  This will be his 8th loan with MFP, and he knows that this loan will be a great help to him.  He thanks the lenders for supporting him with these loans, and now he hopes to continue to benefit from this new loan.  In his communal bank he is a very cheerful member who always keeps order in the meetings.  With the 2,500 Peruvian soles, he will buy a 3-wheeled bike with an attached cart that he will use to transport his products.

loans.use: to buy a 3-wheeled bike with an attached cart that he will use to transport his products.

loans.name: Dewi Fortuna Group

texts.en:
The Dewi Fortuna group is getting their third loan from MUK. There are 11 members in the group and the total loan is Rp 22,000,000. The loan will be used to buy piglets and repair their cages.

Jero Pudak, as the head of the group, is using the loan to buy three piglets of a superior species. The price for superior pig species is currently very expensive, ranging from Rp 400,000 - Rp 500,000. These pigs will be maintained for five months for fattening. Jero Pudak expects during the loan period that the pigs will be able to develop properly, without being attacked by disease. With this effort, she dreams of fixing her house.

loans.use: to buy three piglets

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma, de 34 años, es una mujer trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Telesforo de 35 años y sus 03 queridos hijos, quienes son el pilar de todos sus esfuerzos. La actividad a la que se dedica Norma, es el cultivo de plantas de cacao, café y plátano, en las chacras que heredó de sus padres, ella trabaja todos los días arduamente, para luego llegado el momento adecuado, cosechar sus productos y venderlos en la ciudad de San Francisco. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la libertad que tiene en el desempeño de su labor, ya que ella decide que es lo mejor para sus cultivos, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, ya que la mayoría de veces, le es muy difícil conseguir un carro que quiera llevarla. En adelante, espera comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar sus cultivos. Esta será  su primer crédito con MFP y por ello ya se siente muy contento de saber que contará con el apoyo de los financistas y así progresar gracias al apoyo de ellos. Con el dinero solicitado refaccionará la fachada de su vivienda comprando calaminas y maderas.
texts.en:
Norma, 34 years old, is a hard-working woman who lives in her own house with her husband, Telesforo, who is 35, and her 3 beloved children -- the focus of all her efforts. Norma dedicates herself to cultivating cacao, coffee, and plantains in the fields she inherited from her parents. She works arduously every day, then when the proper moment arrives, she harvests her crops and sells them in the city of San Francisco.

What Norma likes most about her work is the liberty she has in carrying out the task, doing whatever she decides is best for her crops. She has been doing this for 10 years and considers the most difficult task to be transporting her harvests to market. Most often, it is difficult for her to obtain a car to transport what she wants to sell.

In the future, Norma wishes to buy new land to increase her plantings. This will be her 1st loan through MFP and already she feels very content at knowing that she can count on the help of investors and thus, she can progress, thanks to their help.

With the loan she is requesting, Norma will repair the outside of her house, buying sheets of corrugated iron and lumber.

loans.use: buy lumber and sheets of corrugated iron to repair her house.

loans.name: Ma. Merlinda

texts.en:
Ma. Merlinda is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 
Ma. Merlinda has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages like soft drinks. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 (Philippine Pesos) to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. Ma. Merlinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Ma. Merlinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es: Rebeca, natural de la ciudad de Santa Rosa, tiene 32 años, es una mujer trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Raúl de 36 años y sus 03 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. En el poblado de Santa Rosa (Dentro de la selva Ayacuchana), se encuentran los cultivos de Rebeca, sus productos son muy buenos y es por eso que sus plantas de cacao y café, son muy bien cotizados en la ciudad de Santa Rosa y San Francisco, ya que es ahí donde vende toda su cosecha. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus productos, y le satisface el ver su producción luego de varios meses de cuidado y dedicación. Durante el tiempos de cosecha y deshierbo de maleza hace trabajar sus tierras con el apoyo de los jornaleros. Lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es controlar las enfermedades de cada producto que se apoderan mas y mas de los granos de cacao y café. Con el tiempo, espera ampliar sus tierras y así beneficiarse con los frutos de cada planta. Este será su décimo crédito con MFP y espera beneficiarse una vez mas con el apoyo de todos ustedes para seguir progresando y por ende se compromete en devolver puntualmente sus aportes programados. Con los 3,000 nuevos soles comprará fertilizantes naturales para mejorar sus tierras.
texts.en:
Rebeca is 32, and is from the town of Santa Rosa.  She is a hard-working woman who lives in her own house with her husband Raúl, 36, and their three dear children, to whom they want to offer a better quality of life.

Rebeca farms near the town of Santa Rosa in the rural part of Ayacucho department.  Her products are very good. That is why her coffee and cacao plants are highly valued in the towns of San Francisco and Santa Rosa, where she sells all of her harvest. 

What she most likes about her work is harvesting her crops. She finds it satisfying to see the fruits of her labor after many months of care and dedication.  During the times of harvesting and weeding, she works her land with the help of day laborers. 

She has been doing this work for 15 years.  She considers the most difficult part to be controlling crop diseases that are affecting the cacao and coffee beans more and more. In time, she hopes to develop more of her land, and in this way benefit from what every plant produces.

This will be her tenth loan with MFP, and she hopes to benefit once again from the support of the lenders in order to continue making progress.  Consequently she is committed to making her scheduled payments on time.  With the 3,000 nuevos soles, she will buy natural fertilizers to improve her land.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Mercilenda

texts.en:
Mercilenda is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Mercilenda has a shop that sells used clothing or ukay-ukay. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy additional stocks of used clothing to sell.

Mercilenda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Mercilenda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional used clothing to sell

loans.name: Lorenita

texts.en:
Lorenita is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Lorenita has a food shop where she makes & sells viands like afritada & chicken pork adobo. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy raw ingredients needed to make viands.

Lorenita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Lorenita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to make viands

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. Merlita has a pigpen. She sells matured & grown pigs. She also butchers the pigs and sells pork per kilogram. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy animal feeds for the pigs.
Merlita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Merlita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds for the pigs

loans.name: Jenilyn

texts.en:
Jenilyn is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 
Jenilyn has a food shop that makes & sells dishes like pancit bihon (noodles), adobo (a stew) & fried fish. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy raw ingedients needed for making the meals.
Jenilyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jenilyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingedients needed for making meals

loans.name: Joycelyn

texts.en:
Joycelyn is 36 years old and married to a local farmer.  Together they raise four children. Her primary source of income comes from raising hogs and selling them to butchers who come to their village. Joycelyn has been in this business for almost 10 years and usually earns about P1,500 for each hog she is able to sell. According to her, profits earned from the business were insufficient to cover all their expenses, especially for daily necessities for her children. 

Joycelyn needs to strengthen her business to acquire more profits to save for the education of her children. She is now asking for a loan of P6,000 to buy hog feed, medicines and vaccines to ensure good nutrition and future sell them at a higher price.

In the future, she wants to diversify her business and establish a sari-sari store(variety) to have a daily income and somehow help her provide a successful life for her family.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, medicines and vaccines to ensure good nutrition

loans.name: Marisil

texts.en:
Marisil is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with 3 children. Marisil has a shop that sells used clothing or ukay-ukay. She has had this business for 3 years.

She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy additional stocks of used clothing or ukay-ukay to sell.  Marisil has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Marisil hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of used clothing, or ukay-ukay, to sell

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es: Rebeca, natural de la ciudad de Santa Rosa, tiene 29 años, es una mujer trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su pareja Raúl de 32 años y sus 02 queridos hijos Maida de 09 y Aurelio de 04 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Rebeca, es una mujer de ardua labor, se esmera a diario por entregar lo mejor de si misma a los miembros de su familia, ella se dedica al trabajo del agro donde siembra café y cacao. Viene realizando esta actividad hace 05 años con mucho cuidado y laboriosidad,  porque gracias a los frutos que le brinda sus plantas, ella compró una cuadra más de terreno para seguir cultivando. En tiempo de cosechas y deshierbo de malezas tiene que contratar jornaleros para poder avanzar con mayor celeridad en cuanto a su faena programada. Ella cuenta con espacios de tierra sin cultivar, lo cual inevitablemente necesita el apoyo de la entidad financiera para llevar consigo su trabajo, tiene planeado sembrar sus fincas con más plantas de café, por ello acude a los créditos que la institución MFP facilita a las personas de bajos recursos con miras a progresar. Con el tiempo espera comprar más espacios de terreno. Este es su segundo crédito y esta muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá seguro de avanzar con lo planeado. Con el dinero solicitado comprará más semillas de café.
texts.en:
Rebeca is 29, and from the city of Santa Rosa.  She is a hard-working woman who lives in her own house with her partner Raúl, 32, and their two dear children; Maida, who is nine, and Aurelio who is four. Their children are the reason for all their efforts. Rebeca is industrious, and every day she tries very hard to do her best for the members of her family. She is a farmer, and grows coffee and cacao. 

She has been doing this work for five years, with great care and diligence. Thanks to the harvest that her crops provide, she bought another block of land in order to continue farming.  At harvest and at weeding time she has to hire day laborers, in order to get the planned work done more quickly. 

Part of her land is not cultivated, and inevitably, support from a financial institution is required to carry forward the work. She plans to sow her lands with more coffee plants, and for that reason applied for one of the loans that MFP makes available to low income people looking to progress in their lives. In time, she hopes to buy more land. 

This is her second loan, and she is very happy to know that she will have financial support. In this way she will feel confident of moving forward with her plan. She will use the loan to buy more coffee seeds.

loans.use: To buy more coffee seeds.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with 8 children. 
Lourdes has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages . She has had this business for 4 years. 

She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.  Lourdes has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Lourdes hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites, an optimist 34-year-old, has been operating a sari-sari (variety) store for almost six years. Her daily profit of P200 goes toward meals and allowances for her two children.

In order to gain more profits, Marites is requesting a loan of P6,000 to purchase canned goods, soft drinks, breads and instant noodles to sell. In the future, she hopes to establish another business to increase her income so as to support her children's education and lift her family out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soft drinks, breads and instant noodles to sell in her store.

loans.name: Merry Riza

texts.en:
Merry Riza has a livestock business. In particular, she raises pigs. According to her, she has raised three fattening pigs and two sows. She has been in this line of business for seven months. She is thankful because she is able to maintain her business even though her husband is far from them due to his work as a security guard. Her mom taught her the business, and she was able to set up her own livestock business based at their home.

Merry Riza's child is still an infant, which is a great cost in her household expenses. For this reason, she would like to ask for a loan in the amount of PHP 15,000 to purchase a stock of feed for her livestock business. Through the business she manages, she could be able to sustain their daily needs and save some amount to prepare for the schooling of her child. She is hoping that she can improve their standard of living through the profits she generates from her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her livestock business.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Mrs. Ly, age 40, is married to Mr. Bin, age 43. Both of them live in the Kampot Province. She has four single children, all of whom are students and they always depend on her income. 

Mrs. Ly always uses her own farmland to grow a rice crop in both the rainy season and the dry season. Mrs. Ly and her husband make an income of approximately $2.25 USD a day to help cover the family’s expenses. Mrs. Ly would like to request a loan from HKL and Kiva to buy a few sacks of fertilizer so her grow will grow well.

In the future, Mrs. Ly hopes to use her increased income to buy a new pumping machine, to decorate her house and to support her children to finish at least the high school level.

loans.use: to buy a few sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie is a diligent mother. She has three children attending school. Now, due to the increasing cost of basic commodities, Jessie needs to gain more profits to sustain her family's daily consumption of meals and allowances. For 10 years, she has been operating her small sari-sari store (variety) in front of her house. With her daily income, she was able to pay school fees. The other part was used as revolving capital to continuously sell grocery items to the people in her neighborhood. 

Jessie in now asking for an additional capital of PHP 6,000 to buy sugar, vinegar, cooking oil, breads and eggs to sell in her store to increase the capacity of sales from her business. 

Jessie would like to keep making better sales to save for the college education of her three children. She wants them to have their own degree and good employment someday.

loans.use: to buy sugar, vinegar, cooking oil, bread and eggs to sell in her store

loans.name: Anara's Group

texts.en:
Anara is the leader of this group. She is 55 and married to an auto crane driver. Together with her husband, she has raised two daughters and two sons. The daughters are married and live separately with their families. The older son engages in trade in Kazakhstan, and the younger son works in Karabalta (a small town near Bishkek, the capital of Kyrgyzstan). 

Three years ago, with an initial investment of 500 soms, Anara started to breed poultry. She earns about 4000 soms per month selling the eggs and chickens. With the profits gained from this activity, she purchased five sheep for breeding, fattening, and further reselling.  With this loan, Anara wants to purchase chickens and turkeys for breeding. She will use some part of the loan to purchase feed for poultry. In the future, she wishes to purchase a piece of land to start building a new house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (staying environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and to view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team, Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and turkeys.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo is 48 years old and married with three children. According to him, two of his children are still studying. With the help of his wife, they are able to provide their daily needs.

Reynaldo has been running his livestock business for almost 10 years and he's glad because there is improvement. Aside from the livestock business, he had also has a farming business. He is aiming to maintain and improve the businesses he manages so that he can give his two children a good education and secure the future of his family. To make his dreams a reality, he is requesting additional capital in the amount of PHP 15,000 to buy feed for his raised pigs. His requested loan amount will help him to maintain a larger number of raised and fattened pigs. In this regard, his goal, which is obtaining more profit and thereby having a better quality of life, will be fulfilled.

loans.use: to purchase feed for his pigs

loans.name: Mukaramhan's Group

texts.en:
Mukaramhan is the leader of this group. She is 50 and unfortunately, she is a widow. She has raised a daughter and two sons. The daughter is a farmer, the first son works in a cotton factory and the second son works in a cafeteria. In 1999, Mukaramhan saved some money and purchased seeds of cotton. She owns 0.4 hectares of land where she started to grow cotton. By selling some part of the harvest, she earns about 4,000 soms per month. With money received from the loan, Mukaramhan wants to purchase potato seeds. She wants to start cultivating potatoes. In the future, she wishes to build a house for her son.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en:
Sophy stays at home and does housework. Her husband is a pedicab driver. They live in a suburb of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have two daughters; one is a garment worker, and the other stays at home.

The main source of income is from her daughter’s salary. She is asking for another loan of $600 to buy a motorcycle for her daughter to drive to work.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her daughter to drive to work.

loans.name: Phinary

texts.en:
Phinary (who is in the photo) is a weaver. In addition, she also buys some silk and cotton fabrics from her fellow weavers in her village and transports them to sell in other provinces far away from her house.  

Phinary hopes to expand her business by buying additional silk and cotton fabrics to sell, so she is requesting another loan of US $400 to help her capital.

loans.use: To buy additional silk and cotton fabrics to sell

loans.name: Chheang

texts.en:
Chheang and her husband, Kheng, are farmers. They grow rice and vegetables on their farmland in the village where they live. Chheang is asking for a loan of $700 to help with her rice and vegetable farm by purchasing seed, fertilizer and pesticide.

The couple has been married since 2002 and has two young sons. They are living in a village along National Road Number 6, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Photo: Chheang is at home with her young son, not at the farm.

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Met

texts.en:
Met is a weaver, while her husband is a farmer. They live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 2000 and have two children, a son and a daughter. Both children are in school. 

Met is applying for another loan of US$500 to buy one more cow to raise. 

Photo: Met and her husband.

loans.use: To buy one more cow to raise.

loans.name: Aizada's Group

texts.en:
Aizada is the leader of this group. She is 32 and married to a construction worker, who went to work in Russia and earns about 15,000 soms per month. Aizada has four children.  The two older children are in school and the other children are preschool age (under seven).  In order to earn money to meet the family needs, Aizada breeds poultry.  She applied for the loan because she needs additional funds for purchasing chickens and turkeys for breeding. In the future she wants to provide her children with a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and turkeys

loans.name: Glory

texts.en:
Glory is 47 years old and is engaged in sewing clothes and fabric as a source of income. She was blessed with two children. To meet their educational needs requires a lot of sacrifices and hard work.  For this reason, Glory is working hard to earn enough money to provide for the educational needs of her children.

Glory also operates a hog business as an additional source of income. She wants to expand and maximize her businesses by asking for a loan of P5,000 to buy new fabric and to buy feed for her hog. This could increase her net sales and  allow her to save for the future of her beloved children. She hopes they will finish their education and hold degrees someday.  Glory aims for a better living and not to suffer forever from poverty.  That’s why she continues working hard.

loans.use: to buy new fabric to sew, and feed for her hog

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 44 years old and has been a tricycle operator for nine years.  She is married and blessed with two grade-school children. As a tricycle operator, she can afford the daily allowances of her children. She hopes that her children will not resemble her, since she did not finish education because of her poverty. She is working every day just to earn enough money for their education.

For operating daily, her motorcycle also feels weakened similar to a man. Rosalina is requesting a loan amount of P5,000 to be used for maintenance of her motorcycle. She hopes to immediately recover it in order to provide a better transportation services.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
With her desire to improve her family's living conditions, Jovita patiently endures hardship in managing her piggery business as a source of income. According to her, this kind of work isn’t easy.  It requires hard work and endurance to provide nourishment to her pigs so that she will boost her previous profit. She is 55 years old and has been eight years operating her business. She earns about P5,000 every month, and is frequently behind in her daily expenses.

She wants to earn a higher income to sustain the education of her youngest child. Jovita is now asking for a loan of P3,000 to buy feed and vitamins needed by her pigs. With the help of this loan, she hopes to improve her business as well as her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins needed by her pigs

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 57 years old.  She is the owner of a tricycle transportation business, and, because of old age, her son is the one who operates her tricycle.  Virginia is still working hard to provide their needs.  Aside from the transportation business, she also accepts laundry as an additional source of income.

She is requesting a loan of P5,000 to buy new tires and to save some for future use.  She is still dreaming of lifting their life from poverty and experiencing a better living.

loans.use: to buy new tires and a part of it is to save for future use

loans.name: Trần's Group

texts.en:
Ms K. is 52 years old.   She is married and has three children. Her monthly income is an amount of 3,500,000 Vietnamese. She joined the center Seda loans in 2009 to invest in business activities. This is the third cycle. she requested a loan of 8,736,000 Vietnamese to  expand her raising scale such as buying pigs and chickens.

Ms N., her 43 year-old sister, wants a loan of  5,152,000 Vietnamese. This is her first cycle for a Seda loan.  She wants to invest in the business of fruit, such as apples, oranges, mangoes..

loans.use: to  buy  pigs and chickens
